FOREWORD

T

HIS <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">BOOK</span> makes no claim to literary merit. It is
simply a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> of research and documentation,
giving evidence and facts which I trust will help the
reader in drawing his own conclusions. In the course of
my researches as an international political investigator
into the causes of social unrest, I have probed the depths
of infamy which now surrounds, not ours only, but also
the next generation, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> right to lead a decent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span>
should be as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> as was ours. As a woman of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span>
I have witnessed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span> the <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> of which I did not
suspect and I have realised that, due to my " protected "
position in life, they should never have been expected to
have come to my knowledge. Let me tell every woman,
however much " protected", <span class="t10 t12 t16 t20 t21 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whether</span> Dairymaid or
Duchess, that the safeguards which she imagines to be
thrown around herself are but a mirage of the past. Her
own and her children's future are at the mercy of those "
forces " the activities of which it has been my business,
for the

8

OCCULT

THEOCRASY

last ten years, to follow as one of a group of
investigators.
Today, most of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> are afraid to be good.
They strive to be broadminded and tolerant ! It is
fashionable to be tolerant — but mostly tolerant of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span>
— and this new code has reached the proportions of
demanding intolerance of good. The wall of resistance
to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> has <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> been broken down and no longer affords
protection to those who, persecuted by <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> doers, stand
in need of it.
Worse still, there are cases wherein virtuous people's
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> name is relentlessly " filched from them ", but no
effort will be made by the presumed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> to rally
to their defence. Happy are they if they themselves can
discover the cause of their ruin, materiel or moral, either
partial or total.
In <span class="t22 t23 t28 hoverable">offering</span> this <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> to the public, I have endeavoured
to expose some of the means and methods <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> by a
secret world, one might almost say an underworld, to
penetrate, dominate and destroy not only the so-called
upper classes, but also the better portion of all classes.
There are those who feel confident that if they refrain
from joining any <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> or group and avoid entanglements, no harm can befall them. To such, let me say that
situations can be, and are, <span class="t16 hoverable">created</span> for innocent dupes
every <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> and wrecked homes are the direct result.
Neither fortune nor a blameless

FOREWORD

9

<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> led, as it were, in an island of strict virtue in the
midst of a tumultuous sea of evil, spells security.
Irrefutable evidence of a particular example of
underworld tyranny has come into my possession. The
victim's guilt was her reluctance to step from virtue into
the mire of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> which surrounded her. Moreover she
was intolerant of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> and sought to oppose and destroy it.
The <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of her persecution at the <span class="t13 t23 hoverable">hands</span> of her foes is
complete. She belonged to what is termed <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> as did
also some of the other actors in this bewildering drama.
The world, social, financial, legal and, shall we say also,
the underworld, leaving to this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">word</span> its generally
accepted literal meaning, knows them. So many Jekylls
and Hydes stalk about unsuspectingly in our midst !
From such an example I have been led to the
conclusion that, among others, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> factors can help
one from being completely destroyed by the combined
forces of that" underworld " : a flawless life,
independent means and real friends, all <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> of which
must be backed by a fearless determination to fight <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span>
on all points of the Masonic compass.
In these <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t6 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 hoverable">days</span> when apparently vice triumphs and
virtue must be penalized, it may be <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> for all of us to
fight the undertow by which our <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">children</span> may be
dragged under and must of necessity perish. Vice rings
and secret societies

<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> but one vortex into which youth is drawn and
destroyed whilst the " <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> ", because of their
ignorance, look on helplessly in despair.
It is for their instruction that this <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> has been
written. Its compilation has <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> several <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> and, had
it not been for the generous efforts of one of my friends,
Mme de Shishmareff, and of several other persons, I
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> never have been able to complete the task which I
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> out to accomplish.
What must concern us all now is the protection of
decency or, in other <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">words</span> — Equal rights — for such
as are not vice adepts.
This <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> is not complete. It will never be complete,
but for the present it must remain as a study of the root
conditions which have led to present <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> subversive
upheavals and the overthrow of the principles of
Christian civilization.
EDITH

QUEENBOROUGH

" My final <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> is a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">word</span> of warning to American women : Keep
away from the Swamis, the Yogis, the traveling teaching men. You
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> need no such bidding if, for an instant, you guessed the truth.
In your <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> faith, in your eager-minded receptivity of

with unmerited shame. "
Katherine Mayo in Why I wrote Mother India.

I THE RELIGION

SECRET

<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Man</span> is a creature of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span> and matter. To the realm of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span>
belongs metaphysical <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> which, <span class="t10 t12 t16 t20 t21 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whether</span> trained or
untrained, is peculiar to each individual and is subject for its
development or restraint to his will. It is the basis of religion
in the generally accepted <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t17 t19 t25 t26 hoverable">sense</span> of this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">word</span> ; it is purely
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> and can reach the height of mysticism. From it issue
creeds or doctrines and the erection of a theological system of
beliefs.
Imparted to other individuals and accepted by them, the
metaphysical <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> of a few <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> minds has become the
basis of religious systems. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Upon</span> its teaching was grafted a
Ritual or Law, disciplining the life, mystic, moral, social and
even physical, of its adherents or believers. From the exercise
of such laws, theocracy or the rule of priesthood was evolved.
It is to be found in every religion regardless of the <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> that in
some instances like in the Buddhist doctrine of Gautama and
in the teaching of <span class="t0 t6 t8 t9 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t22 t23 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Jesus</span> Christ, nothing is further removed
than ritualism from the metaphysical <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> or religious
conception of the founders.
21

22

OCCULT

THEOCRASY

The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of theocrasy or exercise of government rule
over the masses by a hierarchy of priests or adepts rested on
its dual system of teaching, namely : Exote-rism and
Esoterism, the former a code of discipline of the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> and
mode of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of the masses, the latter the hierarchic school
wherein were trained the chosen adepts destined to safeguard
the rules imposed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> by the <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> priests.
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Upon</span> a close study of the manifold religious systems, the
corruption of which led to theocratic rule, namely,
Brahminism, the Ancient Egyptian Cult, Mosaism or Judaism,
Christianism and Mahometanism, one finds the accepted
belief of Monotheism as the basis of esoteric or secret belief
or doctrine. Monotheism is here <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> in the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t17 t19 t25 t26 hoverable">sense</span> of First
Principle.
Whereas the Egyptian <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> priesthood of Memphis kept
this theory as the esoteric teaching of the <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> adepts, Moses,
<span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> up as one of them, gave it as exoteric or popular belief
to the Israelitic sect to which he belonged, embodying it in a
deity, the terrible Jehovah of the Jews.
Another <span class="t6 hoverable">side</span> of the esoteric teaching was that of occultism,
the development of all <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> psychic forces which, when
misused, lead to the practice of magic. The esoteric part of all
religions or hermeticism, the teaching and practice of
occultism, led to the development of what might be termed
the religion of the secret, which eventually overshadowed and
helped to dissimulate subversive activities.
It is with this that we are chiefly concerned and will
endeavour, to some degree, to show its baneful influence on
<span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> of all creeds and nations. Let the reader bear in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span>
that it is not the <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> to discuss the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span>
occupied and the part played by either Metaphysics and
Philosophy on the one

THE RELIGION OF THE SECRET

23

hand, and Science and Ritualism on the other. The limitations
of each and its encroachment <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the territory of the others,
the ensuing conflicts, are <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> for the history of fanaticism
throughout the ages. Our aim is to follow the outgrowth of
Esoterism and a few of its multiple ramifications in the realm
of perversion and subversion.

CHAPTER

II

THE <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">MEANING</span> OF OCCULTISM

A summary and some explanation of the principal forms of
occultism must precede the chapters which deal with the
historical <span class="t6 hoverable">side</span> of this subject, and the objections, those of the
credulous as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as those of the sceptics, must be foreseen
and forestalled. Many persons are tempted to deny, arbitrarily
and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> examination, statements on matters of which
they have no previous knowledge, but even the possible
criticism of such as these must have received due consideration.
In this age of wireless and aeroplanes, one of the fads of the
modern highbrow is to scoff at such <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span> as sorcerers,
magic and evocations as old wives' tales. Tales of ancient
history ! There are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who refuse to believe in the
<span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> of the supernatural, perhaps we should say
supernormal, even when confronted with the evidence. Such
are the sceptics who deny everything. Hidebound in their
prejudice, they ignore the <span class="t24 hoverable">fact</span> that magic, White or Black, has
now as many adepts as ever, nor can they distinguish between
the different schools of spiritism.
First, there are the charlatans <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> tricks in the line of
Spiritism are generally sooner or later unmasked.
24

THE <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">MEANING</span> OF OCCULTISM

25

Second, there are the Occultists who operate in secrecy and
hide their meetings from all but initiates with the greatest
care.
Many persons are duped by charlatans, so the sceptics
persuade themselves of the absolute non-existence of all
diabolical practices in modern times. They are wrong. For
Occultism flourishes now in Europe, Asia, and America. The
Black Mass is said today in Paris and London, and Satanism
has its faithful followers. On this subject one of the most
eminent writers was Carl Hackse, who, under the pseudonym
of Dr. Bataille, made an extensive study of Occultism and
gave his extremely exaggerated views of it in the <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> Le
Diablc au XIXe Siecle.
The following pages of this <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">chapter</span> are mostly either
quotations or abridgements from that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> :
" According to the teaching of the Christian churches, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span>
allows demons certain limited powers, but they are not
permitted to open the gates of hell and release a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">spirit</span> at the
request of one who evokes the dead. The dead, even damned,
will not show themselves if evoked, nor <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> evocations be
answered by those who had succeeded in attaining the
kingdom of heaven, but devils can and do, says the Church,
substitute themselves for the deceased. They will impersonate
a dead <span class="t1 t8 t11 t16 t20 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">person</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> appearance is demanded by invocations.
" It is also admitted that the fallen angels or spirits will
often manifest to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> being called, The theological
hagiographa cite many cases of diabolical apparitions to
saints, apparitions which these saints have been able to repel
and conquer... but what sceptics and agnostic Christians alike
ignore is that besides the drawing room mediums, mediums
for diversion, there are occultists <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> vile practices are

26

OCCULT

THEOCRASY

veiled in the profoundest mystery. These men, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> moral
<span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t8 t10 t17 t19 t25 t26 hoverable">sense</span> is absolutely perverted, believe in Lucifer, but they
believe him to be the equal of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> and worship him secretly.
"'
Modern Occultism is on the one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">hand</span> practical Cabala and
on the other, Indian Yogism, both of which have always had
their adepts more or less openly.
The Cabala is Occult Science itself. It is the secret theology
of the initiates, theology essentially Satanic. In a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">word</span> the
counter-theology. Our God, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> of the Christians, is the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> in the <span class="t2 t7 t13 t14 t18 t22 t23 t24 hoverable">eyes</span> of the Cabalists ; and for them the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of good, the real God, is Lucifer.
" The Cabala teaches magic or the <span class="t2 t6 t8 t9 t10 t15 t18 t19 t21 t22 t23 t24 t28 t29 hoverable">art</span> of intercourse with
spirits and supernatural beings.
" One cannot be a convinced Cabalist <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> soon
becoming a magician and devoting oneself to the practices of
occultism.
" Not that our Cabalists or contemporary magicians practise
all the different branches of occultism. Some of these have
been abandoned and others are only <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> by charlatans for the
exploitation of superstitious persons, but a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> many,
precisely the most criminal and perverse, are observed in the
hidden dens of our modern Luciferians. " 2
Magic has <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> divisions :
The first is divining magic, subdivided into several
branches of which the principal are :
Astrology
Palmistry
Anthropomancy
Oneirocritics

Aeromancy
Hydromancy
Pyromancy
Cartomancy

1. Bataille, Le Diable au XDC Siecle, vol. I, p. 28.

THE

<span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">MEANING</span> OF OCCULTISM

27

The <span class="t2 t3 t5 t10 t12 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">second</span> is operative magic, also subdivided into
several branches of which the principal are :
Alchemy
Necromancy
Mesmerism
Theurgy
Various miraculous feats
There are moreover some superstitious practices not
specially classed.
Bataille <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> defines some of the foregoing :
Astrology. — Divining the future by the stars. The casting
of horoscopes is its most prevalent practice.
Palmistry. — Divining the future by the hand.
Anthropomancy. — This is one of the practices supposed at
present to have fallen into disuse. It is a horrible, savage
abomination and consists in disembowelling a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> being
for the purpose of divining the future by inspection of the
entrails.
Mediaeval history accuses Gilles de Retz of perpetrating
this crime on children, whom he lured to his castle for the
purpose. Tacitus says that the Druids, in ancient Britain, <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span>
to consult their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Gods</span> by looking into the entrails of their
captives.
Oneirocritics. — Divining the future through interpretation
of dreams.
Aeromancy. — Divination by the study of aerial
phenomena.
Hydromancy. — Divination by the study of liquids or
aquatic phenomena.
Pyromancy. — Divination by fire.
Cartomancy. — Divination by cards.
There is no need to expatiate further on the more or less
grotesque means employed by those who follow these false
sciences. One must be somewhat erratic to imagine that the
future can be foretold by coffee grounds, by the antics of
flames in a grate, by the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span>

28

OCCULT THEOCRASY

in which shuffled cards will be drawn, or by the odd shapes
assumed by wind-driven clouds ! When events corroborate
predictions made under these conditions, it can be attributed
to the <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of clairvoyance, but these fortune
tellers, some of whom have a thorough <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">knowledge</span> of the rules
governing the practices of these absurdities, are the first to
distrust their art.
Such expedients, disdained by the real occultists, are too
unimportant to be worthy of note. It is quite another <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> to
expose the Satanists, ignored by the public, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> sects,
bearing different names in different countries, constitute, in
reality, only one, single, secret religion <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> fanatics,
imbued with the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">spirit</span> of evil, will <span class="t2 t9 t10 t16 t18 t19 t27 t28 hoverable">sacrifice</span> themselves

Gnosticism, as the Mother of Freemasonry, has imposed its

interlaced square and compass, it is the five pointed star

signifies Geometry. To the brothers frequenting the lodges

Let us add that the ancient mysteries of Gnosticism have
been known and published in the past. There is no difference
between the Gnosticism of the early ages of Christianity and
modern occultism.
The fundamental principle of Gnosticism was the double
divinity (dual principle) and this is exactly the theological
theory of modern occultism. The Gnostics claimed that the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> was Lucifer and that <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> was the devil, that what
the Christians <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> vice was for them virtue, and to the
Christian dogma they opposed Gnosticism, a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">word</span> <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> knowledge.
Early Gnosticism had its doctors ; the Basilideans, Ophites
and Valentinians. Basilide of Alexandria, one of them, lived
at the end of the first century. He taught metempsychosis and
the principles underlying present-day Theosophy. His system
resembles that of the spiritists of the nineteenth century who
have invented nothing, for they copy Gnosticism even in its
theory of the transmigration of souls. Basilide affirmed that he
was the reincarnation of Plato. Whoever has penetrated into
assemblies of modern theurgists can attest that one of its
current theories is that of reincarnation.
After Basilide came Montanus who died in 212. Montanus
was a grand <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">master</span> of the <span class="t2 t6 t8 t9 t10 t15 t18 t19 t21 t22 t23 t24 t28 t29 hoverable">art</span> of divination. The Bite of
Mizraim (a Freemasonry said to be Egyptian) copies slavishly,
in its Cabalistic grades, all the phantasmagoria of Montanus.
This Gnostic doctor plunged himself into ecstasies and,
according to history, he had <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> women, Maximilla and
Priscilla, trained to act as his accomplices. The Gnostics came
in crowds to admire their contortions worthy of epileptics.
They had the sacred illness, 10 and were considered <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span>
saints of

and Affections of the Mind; erected Temples and Altars to

This is a hard question to answer.
A modern example of the influence exercised by occult
organizations on the destinies of mankind is to be found in the
history of The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Holy</span> Alliance, founded in 1815 by Alexander I,
Emperor of Russia. This was originally a union of monarchs
pledged to support the Christian Church and to stem the rising
tide of radicalism, revolution and subversion.
In L'Histoire de la Magie (p. 467), Eliphas Levi states that
the spiritist sect of " The Rescuers of Louis XVI ", wishing to
penetrate this organization to <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> it for their own purposes,
succeeded in insinuating one of their illumines into the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span>
graces of the Czar. This was Madame Bouche, known to the
adepts as Sister Salome. After eighteen months spent at the
Russian Court, during which she had many secret interviews
with the Emperor, she was supplanted by another
medium-somnambulist of the sect, the famous Madame de
Krudner who acquired so <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> an influence

Impudence, and Calumny. Every strange Disorder, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as Epilepsy, is

In De la Magonnerie Occulte (pp. 87-88), J. M. Ragon tells

" Natural and symptomatic somnambulism are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span>

another insomuch as the one is commanded (willed) and the

All kinds of nice inspiring symbolical interpretations of the
ritual are generally given for the benefit of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> who seem to

to himself or herself, has acted throughout the ceremony of
initiation under the stress of hypnotism. No longer a <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> agent,
the initiate takes the oath under hypnotic force which, has also
been <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> to instil into him the feeling of fear. <span class="t28 hoverable">Fear</span> guards the
secret of initiation, <span class="t28 hoverable">fear</span> <span class="t16 t24 hoverable">born</span> under the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of hypnotism to
serve henceforth as the controlling agent of the initiators over
the initiated.

one's own purposes, business, political or other, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span>
following the lure of the occult to a sinister end i.e. Black
Magic. 16
We <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> here observe that the miracles performed by
<span class="t0 t6 t8 t9 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t22 t23 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Jesus</span> <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> bore a distinctive feature, often overlooked,
namely, that in every <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> altruism was the source of their
inspiration. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> they were a symbol of charity.
This gives us the esoteric explanation of His silence when
taunted on the cross. " He saved others, himself he cannot
save. " Sooner than <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> for personal advantage He
chose <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">death</span> !
Gnostic miracles, such as that of being buried alive for a
period of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> which constitutes the Hindu religious rites of
Samadhi have no ulterior charitable purpose. They are chiefly
performed for the <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of creating wonderment, curiosity or
<span class="t4 t7 t12 t16 hoverable">faith</span> in magic, and as such, failing the altruistic motive, are
classifiable under the general term of Black Magic.
As a stimulus to popular faith, they are, however,
sanctioned by most Pagan religions, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> where such a
custom prevails, the magical performers themselves are not
privileged to withhold their gains for themselves, as these are
claimed by the Temple.
Having dealt with the preliminaries of the subject, we will
now proceed along the thorny paths of history — not the
history of wars, battles, heroes, but that of the agents of their
being !

BRAHMINISM

For a brief study of Brahminism, the religion practised in
India, we can hardly do better than quote from the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> of
such recognized authorities as Messrs. Stillson and Hughan. '
In attempting to trace the origin of Brahminism, they make
the following observations :
" After being conquered by the Cuthites under Rama, the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">son</span> of Cush, referred to in Genesis x, 2, 7, the Mysteries of
the Deluge were introduced. The worship soon became
divided into <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> sects. We are not fully apprised when was
first introduced the Brahminic system, composed of Brahma,
Vishnu, and Siva, constituting the Trimurti... one branch of
which was mild and benevolent, and addressed to Vishnu, the
Preserver, while the other proclaimed the superiority of Siva,
who was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> the Destroyer and the representative of terror
and penance, barbarity and blood ; in Egypt, represented by
Typhon.
" These Mysteries, whatever may have been their origin, or
for what purposes they were then instituted, were certainly a
corruption of the original worship of

the one Deity. They bore a direct reference to the happiness of
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Man</span> in Paradise, where he was first placed ; his subsequent
deviations and transgressions, and the destruction of the race
by the general deluge... The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> cavern of Elephanta,
perhaps the most ancient temple in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> made by man, in
which these rites were performed and remaining to the
present day, is an evidence of the magnitude of that system...
" The caverns of Salsette, of which there are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> hundred,
all have <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> them carved and emblematic characters. The
different ranges of apartments are connected by open
galleries, and only by private entrances could the most secret
caverns, which contained the ineffable symbols, be
approached, and so curiously contrived as to give the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">highest</span>
effect <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the neophytes when in the ceremonial of initiation.
A cubical cisia, <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> for the periodical sepulture of the
aspirant, was located in the most secret recesses of the cavern.
The consecrated <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> of absolution was held in a carved
basin in every cavern, and on the surface floated the flowers
of the lotus. The Linga or Phallus appeared everywhere most
conspicuous, and oftentimes in situations too disgusting to be
mentioned...
" Sacrifices to the sun, to the planets, and to household
gods, were made accompanied with ablutions of water,
purifications with dung and urine of the cow. This last was
because the dung was the medium by which the soil was made
fertile and reminded them of the doctrine of ' Corruption and
reproduction ' taught in the worship of Siva. "
An initiation is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> described :
" Amidst all the confusion, a sudden explosion was heard,
which was followed by a dead silence. Flashes of brilliant
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> were succeeded by darkness. Phantoms and shadows of
various forms, surrounded by rays of

mace, and the sacred lotus. This image represented
Mahadeva2 himself, in his character of the Destroyer. "

" The study of philosophic <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> does not relieve the

seem that they carry them to the greatest extremes.................
Everything that affects or consumes the body, everything that

<span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> to be meritorious.

these bodily mortifications had assumed a character of
unusual severity. 3

revered by his disciples as a god.
" Seventy Brahmins more than seventy <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> old are chosen
from among the Nirvanys to see that the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> of the Lotus, or
the occult science, is never revealed to the vulgar, and that
those who have been initiated into the sacred <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> are not
contaminated by the admission of any unworthy person. "
(Quoted from the Agrouchada-Parikchai).
" In addition to its attributes as an initiatory tribunal, the
council of the elders also had charge of administering the
pagoda property, from which it made provision for the wants
of its members (of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> classes) who shared everything in
common. It also directed the wanderings of the Fakirs, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span>
duty it is to give manifestations of occult <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> outside.
It also elected the Brahmatma from its own members.

With regard to the rise to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of the Brahmin caste in
India, Mr. Jacolliot writes in Les Fils de Dieu :
" Doubtless, in the midst of this new <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> discontent and
discord were unavoidable. Happy in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> they had
secured, the chiefs of the Brahmins, however, had to consider
means for preserving and insuring it against a reversal of
popular favour. At this distance, it is impossible for us to
judge the mental influences at <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> during a period covering
about <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> <span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span> years, that is to say, from the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> when
the priests united into a kind of corporation to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> when,
enjoying unchallenged authority, they published the Vedhas.
This was a collection of prayers and ancient ceremonies
interspersed with the <span class="t1 t2 t5 t10 t25 hoverable">texts</span> necessary to maintaining their
supremacy under the name oiManou (Sanscrit <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> : <span class="t8 t12 t17 hoverable">wise</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> giver), a new code of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> which, rejecting all the ancient
customs of equality and dividing the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> into castes,
invested the Brahmins with <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> and established the
dogma of the Trimourti or Trinity of God, from which
eventually was to spring polytheism and a host of the most
monstrous superstitions.
" This religious revolution occurred about twelve <span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> before our era, under the Brahmatma Vasichta-Richi.
" The Vedhas and Manou, collected and codified by the
Brahmins were given as coming from Brahma himself, and
anyone doubting the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> of this origin was liable to the
penalty of death. "
As among the Ancient Egyptians the teaching of
monotheism was restricted to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">highest</span> initiates alone.
Jacolliot emphasises this when he writes :
" The worship of the one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> or Zeus unrevealed, reserved
to the priests, was forbidden to the lower

classes, but <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> temples dedicated to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> persons-of the
Trimourti, Brahma, Vishnu, Siva, opened their doors to the
adoration of the people, all of whom were allowed to select
one of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> personages of the trinity they <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> prefer
to worship. "
This division in religious worship which eventually led to
the caste system shows the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of theocratic tyranny, the
Brahmins, seeking to justify the method whereby the control
of the masses is vested in the <span class="t13 t23 hoverable">hands</span> of a few, when preaching
in the pagodas, even now say : " See how logical is this system
of division of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> into castes. It was formed in the
likeness of the divinity, Zeus, sovereign <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">master</span> of all things,
but taking no action himself. This is the Brahmin priest
Brahma, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> who creates, who acts, who directs, that is
the aristocrat or the prince ; Vishnu, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> who preserves,
that is the artisan, the merchant, who produces taxes,
preserving and assuring the prosperity of the <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">State</span> by his <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span>
and industry. As for Siva, the terrible God, he keeps the
Soudra (peasant) in a <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> of humility and obedience
appropriate to his station in life.
" Another very important function appears however to have
been early assigned to him, on which much more stress is laid
in his (Siva) modern worship — that of destroyer — viz., the
character of a generative power, symbolized in the phallic
emblem (Linga) and in the sacred bull (Nandi), the favourite
attendant of the god. This feature being entirely alien from the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> of the Vedic god, it has been conjectured with some
plausibility, that the Linga-worship was originally prevalent
among the non-Aryan population, and was thence introduced
into the worship of Siva. 7
7. Article on Brahminism : Enc. Brit. 9th Edition.

BRAHMINISM

51

One of the most curious facts in the Theocratic System
ruling India is that the principle of equality is evidenced only
in the teaching and practice of Occultism. Members of all
castes are admitted on the same footing to learn magic or
fakirism and compose the class known under the name of
Fakirs. This system of equality is similar to the brotherhood
principle and teaching of democracy advocated in
Freemasonry which was so effectively exploited in all the
lodges that fomented the French Revolution.
" As all castes are admitted to the congregation of the
Fakirs, the lowest of the soudras on entering it becomes the
equal of the Brahmins. In spreading the belief that whosoever
consented to enrol among the <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> initiates of the pagoda, and
to die for the faith, was transported to the abode of Brahma
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> accomplishing further migration on <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> or having to
<span class="t6 t9 t13 t15 t17 t18 t23 t28 t29 hoverable">pass</span> through hell, the Brahmins provided for an inexhaustible
supply of fakirs. "
" Before entering the category of fakir, those who are
destined to illustrate the ceremonies of the cults by their
tortures and death, the new recruits practise the occult
sciences under the direction of initiated Brahmins in the
innermost recesses of the pagodas. "
While " there are indeed extraordinary phenomena in what
is termed by the Brahmins occult science, there are none
which cannot be explained and which are not in accordance
with the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> of nature. "
" To become expert in magic, like the believers in the
philosophic doctrine of the Pitris, the pupil must learn, from a
magician whom the sorcerers <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> their Guru, the formulas of
evocation, by means of which the malign spirits are <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span>
into complete subjection.
" Some of these spirits the magician evokes in pre-

ference to others, probably on <span class="t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">account</span> of their willingness to
do anything that may be required of them. "
" An intimate connection exists between the doctrine of the
ancient Jewish Cabalists and those of the Hindu votaries of
the Pitris — or spirits — <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> scientific <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> is the
Agrouchada-parikchai. 8
" It <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be impossible to enumerate the different drugs,
ingredients and implements that compose the stock-in-trade
of a magician. " 9
The standard Indian <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> on magic is the Oupnek'hat.
Therein is to be found a detailed description of methods
available for producing catalepsy, somnambulism,
hallucination and ecstasy by strength of will and fatigue of the
nervous system. 10
This is what is known to the modern common-sense mortal
as " Yogi stuff ", and it is mostly based on breathing
exercises.
We will now quote from Mr. Sellon :
" It is a little remarkable that of the host of Divinities,
especially in Bengal, Siva is the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> whom they are
especially delighted to honour. As the Destroyer, and one who
revels in cruelty and bloodshed, this terrible deity, who has
not inaptly been compared to the Moloch of Scripture, of all
their Divinities suggests most our idea of the Devil. It may
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">therefore</span> be concluded that the most exalted notion of
worship among the Hindus is a service of Fear. The Brahmins
say that the other <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Gods</span> are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> and benevolent, and will not
hurt their creatures, but that Siva is powerful and cruel, and
that it is necessary to appease him.

" Although this deity is sometimes represented in the

unquestionably the Linga ; a smooth stone rising out of
another stone of finer texture, simulacrum membri virilis, et

capacity of 'Lord of all.' n
" It is necessary, however, to observe here that Professor
Wilson, while admitting that ' the Linga is perhaps the most
ancient <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of homage adopted in India', adds, '
subsequently to the ritual of the Vedhas, which was chiefly, if
not wholly, addressed to the Elements, and particularly to fire.
How far the worship of the Linga is authorized by the Vedhas
is doubtful, but that it is the main purport of several of the
Puranas there can be no doubt.' 12
" The worship of Siva under the type of the Linga is almost
the only <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> in which that deity is reverenced. Its prevalence

sufficiently conspicuous. In Bengal, the Lingam Temples are
commonly erected in a range of six, eight, or twelve on each
<span class="t6 hoverable">side</span> of a Ghaut leading to the river. At Kalma is a circular
group of one hundred and eight temples erected by the Rajah
of Burdwan. These temples, and indeed all those found in
Bengal, consist of a simple chamber of a square <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span>
surmounted by a pyramidal centre ; the area of each is very
small. The Linga of black or white marble, and sometimes of
alabaster slightly tinted and gilt, is placed in the middle. " 13

" Benares is the peculiar seat of this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> of worship. The

and most of the chief objects of pilgrimage are similar blocks
of stone. No less than forty-seven Lingas are visited, all of
preeminent sanctity; but there are hundreds of inferior <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">note</span>
still worshipped, and thousands <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> fame and fashion have
passed away. It is a singular fact, that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> this adoration of
the procreative and sexual Sacti (or power) seen "throughout
nature, hinges the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> gist of the Hindu faith. 14
" Bacchus or Osiris was represented by an equilateral
triangle, and the sectarian mark of the worshippers of Siva is
this hieroglyphic. The worship of Bacchus was the same as
that which is paid to Siva, it had the same obscenities, the
same cruel bloodthirsty rites, and the same emblem of the
generative power. 15
" Durga, Kali, or Maha Kali as the Sacti, spouse or
energetic will of Siva, the destructive power, bears a
remarkable analogy with the Moloch of Scripture, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as
with Typhon, Saturn, Dis, Pluto, and other divinities of the
West. 16
" When the attributes of the Supreme Being began to be
viewed in the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> of distinct individuals, mankind attached
themselves to the worship of the one or the other exclusively,
and arranged themselves into sects : the worshippers of Siva
introduced the doctrine of the eternity of matter. In <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to
reconcile the apparent contradiction of assigning the attribute
of <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t9 t12 t15 t16 t17 t19 t22 t24 t25 t26 hoverable">creation</span> to the principle of Destruction, they asserted
that the

dissolution and destruction of bodies was not real with respect
to matter, which was in itself indestructible, although its
modifications were in a constant succession of mutation ; that
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> must necessarily unite in itself the attributes of
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t9 t12 t15 t16 t17 t19 t22 t24 t25 t26 hoverable">creation</span> and apparent destruction ; that this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> and <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span>
are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> distinct and co-existent principles in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> ; the one

" This Union is worshipped under a variety of names :
Bhava, Bhavani, Mahadeva, Mahamaya, etc. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> the

followers of Siva, to adorn and characterise their favourite
divinity. "
" This seems to have been a popular worship for a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
length of time, out of which sprang <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> sects : the one
personified the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> Universe and dispensations of
providence (in the regulation of it) under the name of Prakriti,
and which we from the Latin <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> nature. This sect retains the
Sacti only, and were the originators of the Sactas sects, or
worshippers of Power. The other sect <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> for their symbol the
Male emblem (Linga) unconnected with the female Sacti (or
Yoni). There was also a <span class="t7 hoverable">third</span> sect, who adored both male and
female.
" According to Theodoret, Arnobius, and Clemens of
Alexandria, the Yoni of the Hindus was the sole <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of
veneration in the mysteries of Eleusis.17
" It is not only the votaries of Siva who adore their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span>
under the symbolic <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> of the Linga; the Vaishnavas, or
followers of Vishnu, <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> the same
17. ibid., p. 23.

medium. They also are Lingayetts, one of the essential
characteristics of which is wearing the Type on some part of
their dress or person. 18
" The Vaishnavas are divided into many sects. They
comprise the Ghoculasthas, the Yonijas, the Ramani, and
Radha-balluthis.
" The Ghoculasthas adore Krishna, while the Ramani
worship Rama ; both have again branched into <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> sects —
one consists of the exclusive worshippers of Krishna, and
these only are deemed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> and orthodox Vaishnavas... As
Parameswarra, Krishna is represented of a black or dark blue
colour. Now the Tulasi is the black Ocymum, and all animals
or vegetables of a black or blue colour are sacred to him. His
linga also is always either black or dark blue, and may <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> be
distinguished from that of Siva, which is generally white.
" This divinity, as Parameswarra, is Janan'nauth
(Juggernaut), or ' <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Lord</span> of the Universe ', and it is under the
wheels of his sacred car that so many misguided <span class="t1 t4 t8 t16 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">beings</span>
annually immolated themselves.
" To return, however, to the Vaishnavas. Another of their
sects adore Krishna and his mistress Radha united. These are
the Lingionijas, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> worship is perhaps the most <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> of all
the Pujas. A third, the Radha-ballubhis, dedicate their
offerings to Radha only. The followers of these last
mentioned sects have adopted the singular practice of
presenting to a naked girl the oblation intended for the
Goddess, constituting her the living impersonation of Radha.
Rut when a female is not to be obtained for this purpose, the
votive offerings are made to an image of the Yoni, or emblem
of the feminine power. These worshippers are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span>
18. Ibid., p. 40.

BRAHMINISM

57

Yonijas, in contradistinction to the Lingayats, or adorers of
the Krishna (Vishnu) Linga.
" As the Saivas are all worshippers of Siva and Bowannee
(Pavati) conjointly, so the Vaishnavas also offer up their
prayers to Laksmi-Nayarana. The exclusive adorers of this
Goddess are the Sactas.
" The caste mark of the Saivas and Sactas consists of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span>
horizontal lines on the forehead with ashes obtained, if
possible, from the hearth on which a consecrated <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">fire</span> is
perpetually maintained. The adoration of the Sacti is quite in
accordance with the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">spirit</span> of the mythological system of the
Hindus. It has been computed that, of the Hindus in Bengal, at
least three-fourths are Sactas, of the remaining fourth, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span>
parts are Vaishnavas, and one, Saivas.
" Independently of the homage paid to the principal Deities,
there are a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> variety of inferior beings, Dewtas, and
demi-gods of a malevolent character and formidable aspect,
who receive the worship of the multitude. The bride of Siva,
however, in one or other of her many and varied forms, is by
far the most popular goddess in Bengal and along the Ganges.
" The worship of the female generative principle, as
distinct from the Divinity, appears to have originated in the
literal interpretation of the metaphorical language of the
Vedhas, in which Will, or purpose to Create the Universe, is
represented as originating from the Creator and co-existent
with him as his bride, and part of himself. "
" Although the adoration of the Sacti (the personified
energy of the Omnipotent) is authorized by some of the
Puranas, the rites and formulae are more clearly <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> forth in a
voluminous collection of books <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> Tantras.
These
writings convey their <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> in the

similitude of dialogue between Uma (or Siva) and Pavati.
" The followers of the Tantras profess to consider them as a
fifth Vedh, and attribute to them equal antiquity
and
superior authority. "
" The Tantras are too numerous to specify them further,
but the curious reader will <span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span> them under the heads of
Syama Rahasya, Anandra, Rudra, Yamala, Mandra,
Mahodahi, Sareda, Tilika, and Kalika-Tantras.
" Although any of the goddesses may be objects of the
Sacta worship, and the term Sacti comprehends them all, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span>
the homage of the Sactas is almost restricted, in Bengal, to the
consort of Siva. The Varnis, or Vamacharis, worship Devi as
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as all goddesses. Their worship is derived from a portion
of the Tantras.
" According to the immediate <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of the worshipper is
the particular <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> of worship ; but all the forms require the
<span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of some or all of the five Makaras — Mansa, Matsya,
Madya, Maithuna, and Mudra — that is : flesh, fish, wine,
women, and certain mystical gesticulations with the fingers.
Suitable Muntrus, or incantations, are also indispensable,
according to the end proposed, consisting of various
unmeaning monosyllabic combinations of letters, of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
imaginary efficacy.
" When the <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of worship is to acquire an interview
with, and control over, impure spirits, a dead <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> is
necessary. The adept is also to be alone, at midnight, in a
cemetery or <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> where bodies are burnt. Seated on the
corpse he is to perform the usual offerings, and if he do so
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> <span class="t28 hoverable">fear</span> or disgust, the Dhutas, the Yoginis, and other
male and female demons become his slaves. 19
" In this and many of the observances practised,

solitude is enjoined, but all the principal ceremonies
comprehend the worship of Sacti, or Power, and require, for
that purpose, the presence of a young and beautiful girl, as the
living representative of the goddess. This worship is mostly
celebrated in a mixed <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> ; the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span> of which represent
Bhairavas, or Viras, and the women, Bhanravis and Nayikas.
The Sacti is personified by a naked girl, to whom meat and
wine are offered, and then distributed among the assistants.
Here follows the chanting of the Muntrus and sacred texts, and
the performance of the Mudra, or gesticulations with the
fingers. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> terminates with orgies amongst the
votaries of a very licentious description. This ceremony is
entitled the Sri Chakra or Purna-bisheka, The Ring or <span class="t5 hoverable">full</span>
Initiation. 20
" This method of adoring the Sacti is unquestionably
acknowledged by the <span class="t1 t2 t5 t10 t25 hoverable">texts</span> regarded by the Vanis as
authorities for the impurities practised.
" The members of the sect are sworn to secrecy, and will
not <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">therefore</span> acknowledge any participation in Sacta-Puja.
Some <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> ago, however, they began to throw off this reserve,
and at the present <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> they trouble themselves very little to
disguise their initiation into its mysteries, but they do not
divulge in what those mysteries consist.
" The Kauchiluas are another branch of the Sactas sect;
their worship much resembles that of the Caulas. They are,
however, distinguished by one particular rite not practised by
the others, and throw into confusion all the ties of female
relationship ; natural restraints are wholly disregarded, and a
community of "women among the votaries inculcated.
" On the occasions of the performance of <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">divine</span>

worship, the women and girls deposit their " julies ", or
bodices, in a box in charge of the Guru, or priest. At the close
of the rites, the male worshippers <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">take</span> each a " julie " from the
box, and the female to whom it belongs, even were she his
sister, becomes his partner for the evening in these lascivious
orgies.
" In every temple of any importance in India we <span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span> a
troupe of Nautch or dancing girls attached.
" These women are generally procured when quite young,
and are early initiated into all the mysteries of their profession.
They are instructed in dancing and vocal and instrumental
music, their chief employment being to chant the sacred
hymns, and perform nautches before the God, on the
recurrence of <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> festivals. But this is not the only service
required of them, for besides being the acknowledged
mistresses of the officiating priests, it is their duty to
prostitute themselves in the courts of the temple to all comers,
and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> raise funds for the enrichment of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> of worship
to which they belong... A Nautch woman esteems it a peculiar
privilege to become the Radha Dea on such occasions. It is an
office indeed which these adepts are, on every account, better
calculated to fulfil with satisfaction to the sect of Sacteyas,
who require their aid, than a more innocent and
unsophisticated girl.
" The worship of Sacti is the adoration of Power, 21 which
the Hindus typify by the Yoni, or womb, the Argha or vulva,
and by the leaves and flowers of certain plants <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t12 t14 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">thought</span> to
resemble it. 22

Heckethorn tells us that the Maharajas constitute another
sect of priests and adds : " It appears abundantly from the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t25 t29 hoverable">works</span> of recognized authority <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> by Maharajas, and from

followers the like character of incarnations of that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">god</span> by
hereditary succession. The ceremonies of the worship paid to
Krishna through these priests are all of the most licentious
character. The <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t8 t13 t15 t17 t18 t21 t22 t23 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">love</span> and subserviency due to a Supreme Being
are here materialized and transferred to those who claim to be
the living incarnations of the god. Hence the priests exercise
an unlimited influence over their female votaries, who
consider it a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> honour to acquire the temporary regard of
the voluptuous Maharajas, the belief in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> pretensions is
allowed to interfere, almost vitally, with the domestic
relations of husband and wife. " 23
