The Tree of Christianity gave forth <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> main branches,
the Catholicism of Rome, Greek Catholicism, and in the XVI
Century, Lutherism. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> former bodies remained
homogeneous but Lutherism gave birth to innumerable sects
all dissenting from the parent church.

CHAPTER

XI

MANICHEISM

Manicheism is the religion of the followers of Manes, a
slave who was sold to a widow who freed and adopted him,
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> making him the " <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">son</span> of the widow " a name which after
him passed to all his followers and is still <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> in Masonic
Lodges.
Of Manicheism, C. W. Olliver, considered an authority on
all masonic matters, writes :
" Manicheism was one of the most important attempts to
found a universal religion and to reconcile the Christian,
Buddhist, and Mazdean with the Greek philosophy. It
presented the same syncretic ideas found later among Moslem
Druzes and among Sikhs. It failed in the first <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> because
Islam presented a much simpler system in the East, and
because in the West Christianity was already developing, in
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of Manes, a religion which aimed at reconciling the
Paganism of Italy and Gaul with the ethics of Christ, this
presenting a simpler and more familiar faith. But the one
achievement of Manes was the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t9 t12 t15 t16 t17 t19 t22 t24 t25 t26 hoverable">creation</span> of the Devil which led
to an afterwards unremovable taint throughout religion.
Manes was a notable philosopher and religious teacher <span class="t16 t24 hoverable">born</span>
about the year A. D. 216, and he was crucified and flayed
alive by the Persian
108

MANICHEISM

109

Magi under Bahram I in the year A. D. 277. His Persian name
was Shuraik, rendered Cubricus in Latin. " 1
He was the slave of the wife of a certain Terebinth who
was a disciple of Scythianus of the race of the Sarrasins.
Olliver tells us further that : " His Acta Archdei became the
Manichean Bible with sundry added epistles. He taught the
Mazdean dualism of the powers of <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> and darkness, as
representing <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> beings, and an asceticism which
aimed at the control of all passions. Manes repudiated
Judaism, and like the Gnostics, regarded Jehovah as an <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span>
God. The Mani-cheans were more hated and feared by
Catholic Christians than any other sect. They were still in
<span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> in spite of constant persecution as late as our tenth
century, and their influence was felt from China to Spain and
Gaul. It still lingers in Asia, and among the ' Christians of St.
Thomas ' in Madras it survived till the fifteenth century. St.
Augustine had listened for nine <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> to Manes, but the
Roman Empire felt the force of this system chiefly in A. D.
280. The Romans knew it themselves in A. D. 330, and
Faustus became its missionary among them. Many clung to
Manicheism till A. D. 440, when Leo the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Great</span> found that he
must stamp it out if the Roman creed was not to be extinguished. It was the basis of the Paulican heresy, and of that of
the Albigenses in the South of France which was only
quenched by blood in the thirteenth century.
" The doctrine of Manes can be summed up as follows. He
believed in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> gods, or, more exactly, principles, the
principle of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> and that of evil. Before the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t9 t12 t15 t16 t17 t19 t22 t24 t25 t26 hoverable">creation</span> of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> the ' <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of darkness ' revolted against the God, and
God, incapable of with1. C. W. Olliver, An Analysis of Magic and Witchcraft, p. 102.

standing the attack, gave to them a portion of His essence.
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of darkness having <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> them the principle of

of the Devil. " 2
Summers, another authority, further explains that " it must
be clearly borne in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span> that these heretical bodies with their
endless ramifications were not merely exponents of erroneous

CHAPTER

XII

WITCHCRAFT

Margaret Alice Murray, writing in The Witch-cult in Western
Europe establishes both the phallic and religious character of the "
craft ", in her remarkable <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> from which we extract part of the
following valuable information :
The deity worshipped by the witches was in some cases Lucifer,
as the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Good</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> in opposition to Adonay, the Christian <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> in His
character of the benefactor of humanity, and in other instances
Satan, the same spirit, as the Principle of Evil.
This is evident from the various references to their deity adduced
in the trials of persons accused of this heresy. In both cases however,
the devotees, <span class="t10 t12 t16 t20 t21 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whether</span> of Lucifer or Satan, were obliged formally to
renounce Christ, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Holy</span> Ghost and the Christian God, before
embracing the Devil <span class="t4 t7 t12 t16 hoverable">faith</span> which was the logical outgrowth of the
Mazdean-Manichean Dualist doctrine of the double divinity. ;
1. " Epiphanius gives an <span class="t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">account</span> of a sect of Heretics <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span>
Satanians. ' Satan, say they, is a very <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> and potent Person, and
author of much Mischief. Why, therefore, should we not chiefly fly
to him, and adore him, honour, and praise trim, that for our flattering
worship he may do us no harm, but

113

The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> of the witches seems to have been generally
represented either as the double faced <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> Janus or the
goat-headed Baphomet, the latter variously modified but
usually bearing between the horns on its <span class="t7 t11 t15 t22 hoverable">head</span> the phallic
emblem of a lighted candle.
Esoterically, this candle symbolized the sex-force or
Kundalini risen to the pineal gland.
Cotton Mather stated that the witches " <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> themselves
after the manner of Congregational Churches, " and M. A.
Murray gives the following description of their leader :
" The Chief or supreme <span class="t7 t11 t15 t22 hoverable">Head</span> of each district was known to
the recorders as the ' Devil '. Below him in each district, one
or more officers — according to the size of the district —
were appointed by the chief. The officers might be either <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span>
or women; their duties were to arrange for meetings, to send
out notices, to keep the record of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> done, to transact the
business of the community, and to present new members.
Evidently these persons also noted any likely convert, and
either themselves entered into negotiations or reported to the
Chief, who then <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> action as opportunity served. At the
Esbats the officer appears to have <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> command in the
absence of the Grand <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> ; at the Sabbaths the officers
were merely heads of their own Covens, and were known as
Devils or Spirits, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> recognized as greatly inferior to the
Chief. The principal officer acted as clerk at the Sabbath and
entered the witches' report in his <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> ; if he were a priest or
ordained minister, he often performed part of the religious
service ; but the Devil
Pardon us as being his own servants ? ' Hence they <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> themselves Satanians. " Bishop Lavington, The Moravians Corn-Pared
and Detected, p. 170.

himself always celebrated the mass or sacrament. "
From Lemoine in La Tradition, published 1892, we learn
that the garter is the distinctive mark of the witch leader, for a
woman shared this honour with the Grand <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> as the
Grand Mistress and in some cases occupied the office of
deacon.
Animal masks seem to have been a popular <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> of
disguise adopted by the witches and wizards attending
meetings, and this custom is probably responsible for many
of the stories of witch lycanthropy.
Among other obscene and phallic witch-rites was the
Black Mass, celebrated by a renegade priest <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the naked
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of the adept for <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> benefit it was performed. It
symbolized the perversion of all the rites of the Catholic
church. Black candles instead of white, inverted crosses,
chalices containing the blood of new-born infants sacrificed
for ritual purposes, urine for <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">holy</span> water, all these were part of
the paraphernalia needed, according to historians, to propitiate the Prince of Darkness and his retinue of minor Devils.
Besides evocations, casting of spells and sex-orgies, devil
worship entailed such inanities as desecration of the hosts
stolen from catholic churches and the kissing of the Grand
<span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> (devil) on the tail or membrum virile.
Only hosts consecrated in Roman Catholic churches could
serve for Black Mass purposes as it was essential, in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to
achieve desecration, that the miracle of transubstantiation
should have <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> place. The host had actually to be, not
merely to represent, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> and blood of Christ.

again became <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">master</span> of His Altar ; the flood of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> folly
had passed ! "
In 1484, Pope Innocent <span class="t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t10 t12 t17 t21 t25 t26 hoverable">VIII</span> issued a bull against the craft
couched in the following terms :
" It has come to our ears that numbers of both sexes do not
avoid to have intercourse with demons, Incubi and Succubi;
and that by their sorceries, and by their incantations, charms
and conjurations, they suffocate, extinguish, and cause to
perish the births of women, the increase of animals, the corn
of the ground, the grapes of the vineyard and the fruit of the
trees, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as men, women, flocks, herds, and other various
kinds of animals, vines and apple trees, grass, corn and other
fruits of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> ; making and procuring that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span> and
women, flocks and herds and other animals shall suffer and
be tormented both from <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> and without, so that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span> beget
not, nor women conceive ;

and they impede the conjugal action of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span> and women. "
Eliphas Levi, in Histoire de la Magie, (p. 116) gives the
following explanation of the supposed origin of " elementals "
known by spiritists as " dwellers on the threshold. "
He states that; " according to the best authorities, these
spirits (larves) possess an ethereal <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> formed of the vapour
of blood. That is why they seek blood and why they were
supposed, formerly, to feed on the smoke of sacrifices.
" They are the Incubi and Succubi, the monstrous <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">children</span>
of impure dreams.
" When sufficiently condensed to be visible, they are only a
vapour coloured by the reflection of a picture and, having no
independent life, they imitate the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of him who evokes
them as the shadow does the body.
" They generally manifest around the persons of idiots and
<span class="t1 t4 t8 t16 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">beings</span> devoid of morality <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> isolation has led them to
develop irregular habits.
" Owing to the feeble cohesion of the parts of their fantastic
bodies, they <span class="t28 hoverable">fear</span> the open air, fire, and above all, the point of
swords, and as they live only by the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of those who have
<span class="t16 hoverable">created</span> or evoked them, they become the vaporous
appendices of the real <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of their parents. So it can happen
that an injury inflicted on them might actually react <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the
parent body, as the unborn child is really wounded or
disfigured by an impression made <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> its mother.
" These elementals draw the vital heat from persons in
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> health and quickly exhaust those who are weak.
" They are the source of the stories of vampires, stories
only too <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> and periodically recurrent, as everyone knows.

WITCHCRAFT

117

" That is why one feels a chill of the atmosphere when
approaching mediums who are persons obsessed by these
spirits that never manifest in the presence of anyone able to
unveil the mystery of their monstrous birth. They are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">children</span>
of an exalted imagination or unbalanced mentality... "
In politics, throughout the ages, witchcraft, as practised by
subversive sects, has played a prominent part.
Illustrations of this are to be found in the <span class="t1 t3 t5 t16 t19 t25 hoverable">case</span> of the North
Berwick Witches who were tried for treason in 1592 when
their Devil or Grand Master, Francis Stewart, Earl of
Bothwell, attempted to supplant James VI as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">King</span> of
Scotland. The Black Masses held by the infamous Abbe
Guibourg for Madame de Mon-tespan, with the <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of
regaining for her the favour of Louis XIV, are famous in
history.
Eliphas Levi, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> initiate, has <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> defined the aims of
magic and witchcraft :
" To deceive the peoples for the purpose of exploiting them,
to enslave them and delay their progress, or prevent it even if
possible, such is the crime of black
ii 4

magic.
Proof of the foregoing devil worship and contact with
spirits or devils is found in history, even as late as 1819 when
we read that; " The Devil met Margaret Nin-Gilbert etc... "
Studying the history of the Mopses in 1761 we <span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span> its Grand
Masters, Grand Mistresses and Deacons, adorned with the
distinctive " Garter " of the witch, performing the ceremonial
of kissing the Devil's tail as part of the ritual of 18th Century
Masonry. The "Coven" of the Middle Ages is the Masonic '
Lodge " of today, but the " Craft " remains the " Craft ".

CHAPTER

XIII

THE GNOSTICS
(The Heretics)

Gnosticism, like the Ancient Mysteries, was founded on
Spiritism, their mediums giving instructions purporting to
come from the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Gods</span> or Spirits.
In the Christian era, one of the earliest prominent Gnostics
was Simon Magus, a Jew and an adept of the sect of
Dosithians.
This article is composed of certain passages transcribed
verbatim from The Moravians Compared and Detected by
Lavington. (See pages XIII, 59, 105 to 109 and 133).
Among the successive disciples of Simon Magus were —
Basilides, Valentinius, Carpocrates, Marcus, Marcion, Cerdo,
Epiphanes, Montanus, etc., and according to Bishop
Lavington, " these were Heretics, and, that they were Heretics
of the worst Kind that ever defiled and disgraced the Christian
Name, is allowed by all Denominations of Christians.
" Some of these lived in the first Century and even in the
Apostles' Days, but the <span class="t2 t3 t5 t10 t12 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">second</span> Century was most fruitful in
the Production of this Generation of Vipers and we must
receive our <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Knowledge</span> of their abominable Tenets from the
early Ecclesiastical writers
118

THE

119

such as Irenoeus... Epiphanius... Theodoret... and many
others...
" The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Spirit</span> among these Heretics <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">went</span> by different Names,
Ogdoas, Sophia, Terra, <span class="t28 hoverable">Jerusalem</span> and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Lord</span> in the masculine
Gender : — Is particularly <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> both Prunicus and Prunica ;

Mother is a Woman from a Woman. Sometimes their
celestial <span class="t1 t4 t8 t16 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">Beings</span> are neither Male nor Female : sometimes
interchangeably either male or female.
" Such was the Excellency of their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Knowledge</span> and

are above Principalities and Powers, secure of Salvation : and
for that very <span class="t1 t3 t8 t25 hoverable">Reason</span> are <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> to debauch Women, or indulge
all manner of Licentiousness — This <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Knowledge</span> is of itself
perfect Redemption, and sufficient. " — " Simon Magus, who
taught that his Harlot Helena was the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Holy</span> Ghost, instituted
certain foul and infamous Mysteries inexpressibly filthy and
had Assemblies equally filthy to celebrate them : These being
the Mysteries of Life, and of the most perfect Knowledge. "
" The Carpocratians... practised all manner of Philtres and
Enchantments : in order, as they speak, to have <span class="t5 hoverable">full</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Power</span> in
all Things, and to do whatever they please. — Hence they
spend their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Time</span> in Luxury and Pleasure and bodily
Enjoyments : nor ever come among us, unless it be to ensnare
unstable Souls, and entice them into their impious Doctrine.
"
" For this end they taught Incontinence to be obligatory, as
a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Law</span> : and not only lawful, but necessary to Salvation ; not
only compatible with the Saviour's Religion, but an essential
Part of it : and those were

because he mingleth in Concupiscence. ' <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Therefore</span>
Continence, say they, is necessary to us natural <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Men</span> ; but by
no means to themselves, who are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> and perfect; among
whom the Seed, small from above, is perfected here. "
Compare Ter-tullian, p. 261.
" To quote Clemens Alexandrinus. ' I will <span class="t4 t6 t7 t9 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 hoverable">bring</span> in to open
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Light</span> your most secret Mysteries : not ashamed to <span class="t9 t11 t20 t21 t22 t23 t27 hoverable">speak</span> what

worship those Parts, which modesty forbids to mention. "

CHAPTER

XIV

LAMAISM

Lamaism was founded about 407 A. D. by a Bodi-satva
called, it is said, Chomschim, in Chinese Boyan-chi-yin, (the
<span class="t23 hoverable">voice</span> which reflects the world) on the mountain Bouthala
around which was built the sacred <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">city</span> of Lhassa.
Lamaism is not only a religion, it is a theistic government.
In 1206, when Tibet was conquered by Ghengis Khan
(Mongol), Buddhism became the established religion but in
1368 when Tibet fell from the <span class="t13 t23 hoverable">hands</span> of the Mongols into
those of the Chinese, Lamaism, losing its temporal power,
became merely a religion, its <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t29 hoverable">spiritual</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> remaining
however the same and the religion of more than 250 million
men.
The Lamas are Priests of <span class="t0 t14 t18 t19 t24 hoverable">Buddha</span> among the Mongols and
Tibetans, but Lamaism is not orthodox Buddhism.
Gautama Buddha, the founder of Buddhism, laid down the
following laws governing the attainment of Nirvana (state of
not being). Their enumeration will serve to show how
Buddhism and Lamaism differ.
According to that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> teacher the ten obstacles which
prevent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> from attaining the supreme liberation are : —
123

124

THEOCRASY

1. The belief in the " Ego ",
2. Doubt,
3. The belief in the efficacity of rites and ceremonies,
4. Sensual desires,
5. Anger,
6. The wish to live in a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> less coarse than our own,
7. The wish to live in a more subtle <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> than our own,
8. Pride,
9. Agitation,
10. Ignorance.
The few quotations given hereafter from the very
remarkable books of Madame Alexandra David-Neel can
only serve to show students of these subjects the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> value
of the books themselves.
Quoting Bhagavad Gita, she writes :
" Orthodox Buddhism denied the <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> of a permanent
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">soul</span> which transmigrated, and considered this theory as the
most pernicious of errors but the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> majority of Buddhists
have fallen back into this old belief of the Hindus concerning
the 'jiva ' (self) which periodically changes its old <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> for a
new one, as we cast off old clothes for new. " 2
The Tibetan clergy comprises a theocratic aristocracy the
members of which are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> Lamas, " tulkous ".
" According to popular belief, a tulkou is either the
reincarnation of a saint or dead sage or else the incarnation of
a superhuman being, a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">god</span> or a demon.
In answer to a question she put to the Dalai-Lama on the
definition of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">word</span> " tulkou " Madame David-Neel quotes
him as saying : — "A Bodhisatva is the base from which can
spring numberless magical forms. The force he engenders by
a perfect concentration

The usual method employed for locating the new <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span>

The palace of the Dalai-Lamas is the monastery of Gahlden
situated some twenty kilometres from Lhassa. It was founded
by Tsong Khapa in the XV century. Tsong Khapa, the
reformer, forbade marriage and the <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of fermented
beverages to the clergy. His followers <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> Gelougspas are
known as the Yellow Sect and their favourite <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> is Jigsdjied,
the destroyer (the terrible), another version of the Hindu <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">god</span>
Siva. The Red Sect, the Sakyapas, those distinguished by
their red hats, are their religious opponents.
As regards the Tibetan <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">gods</span> and the ritual pertaining to
their worship Madame David-Neel gives us the following
most illuminating description :
" To the respiratory exercises repeated several times a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span>
the recluse often joins meditation-contemplation assisted by
Kyilkhors.
" A Kyilkhor, or magic circle, is a kind of diagram drawn
on paper or stuff or engraved on metal, stone or wood...
Deities or lamas are generally represented on them by little
pyramids of paste <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> ' torma. ' 7
" Kyilkhors are also designed with coloured powder on

received a special initiation may compose or

draw them. Each Kyilkhor, moreover, requires a particular
initiation and that erected by a non-initiate <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> remain a

" The Hindus endow magical diagrams as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as the

The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> infused into the latter is kept up

suddenly be deprived of this subtle food, the living <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">soul</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> it will perish and die of inanition the <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> reverting
to its former condition of inert matter. " 8
The Tibetan mystics animate their Kyilkhor by a similar
method, but they do not aim at making it an <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of worship
and the material representation of the Kyilkhor is abolished
when, after a certain amount of practice, it becomes purely a
mental image.
A tradition of the Kahgyudpas relates that the founder of
their sect, Marpa, was blamed by his <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">master</span> (guru) Narota for
having paid homage first to the Kyilkhor.
" It is I who constructed the Kyilkhor ", declared Narota. "
Its <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> and energy were infused in it by me. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Without</span> me, those
figures <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be only inert objects. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">gods</span> that inhabit it
are <span class="t16 t24 hoverable">born</span> of my <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">spirit</span> therefore, it is to me that homage is
primarily due. " 9

OCCULT THEOCRASY

" According to Tibetan occultists, these beings, (the gods)
have acquired a kind of real <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> due to the innumerable
thoughts which have been concentrated on them 10.
" According to the Tibetans, during the celebration of a rite,
the thoughts of the officiating evocator, concentrated on the
deities who ' exist already ', cause these to become more
powerful and more real for him. By identifying himself with
them the evocator establishes contact with an accumulation of
energy infinitely greater than that which he alone might
generate. "n
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> we must conclude that the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">gods</span> of Eastern Magic
correspond to what our occidental scientists <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span>
thought-forms. That these thought-forms can be projected
and reabsorbed into the <span class="t1 t8 t11 t16 t20 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">person</span> of their creator is a theory with
which all students of spiritism and psychic science are
familiar, but that they can detach from their makers and lead
separate existences, empowered for <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> or <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> by the
collective thought-force of their worshippers, is an idea with
which the western <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> is still unfamiliar.
" Gods, Demons, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> universe is a mirage, a fantasy
of the brain issuing therefrom and resolvant thereto. " n
" <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> the aim of the teaching is to <span class="t4 t6 t7 t9 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 hoverable">bring</span> the student to
understand that the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> and all its phenomena are but
phantasms <span class="t16 t24 hoverable">born</span> of our own imagination. This in short is the
fundamental teaching of the Mystics of Tibet. " 13

Madame David-Neel tells the following anecdote of the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Great</span> Master.

lived in that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> practising such austerities. " Twenty-five

" And what results have you obtained after such dire efforts
" ? queried the <span class="t0 t14 t18 t19 t24 hoverable">Buddha</span> further.
" I am able to cross a river walking on the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">water</span> ", proudly
declared the anchorite : —
" Ah 1 My poor friend! " answered the Sage sympathetically, " have you really wasted so much <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> for that, when
for a pittance you can get <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> across it on the ferry ! "

THE YEZIDEES (DEVIL WORSHIPPERS)

The sect of the Yezidees was founded by Sheik Adi in the
fifth century.
Mr. W. B. Seabrook's observations on the Yezidees, as
recorded in his book, Adventures in Arabia, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> a basis for
the study of the beliefs of this sect.
According to his informant, the Yezidee <span class="t4 t7 t12 t16 hoverable">faith</span> is briefly
this : l
" <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> <span class="t16 hoverable">created</span> seven spirits ' as a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> lighteth one lamp
after another ', and the first of these spirits was Satan, whom
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> made supreme ruler of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">earth</span> for a period of ten
<span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span> years. And because Satan was supreme <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">master</span> of
the earth, those who dwelt on it could prosper only by doing
him homage and worshipping him.
" Since the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> name was forbidden ", Mechmed Hamdi
told me, " they referred to Shaitan as Melek Taos (Angel
Peacock) and worshipped him in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> of a brass bird ..."
While the name of Shaitan was forbidden ", he said, " so
much so that if a Yezidee hears it spoken, their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span>
commands him either to kill the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> who uttered

We know that this is not true. He is the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">spirit</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> and the

The Grand Priest of the order, the " Mir ", receives
one-seventh part of the harvests of the land. He is the arbiter
of all religious matters and under him rank seven
ecclesiastical orders.
The doctrine of the Yezidees is contained in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> sacred

the sect as a serious sin.

XVI

ORTHODOX ISLAM
The Arabian peninsula was the home of nomads and
mountaineers when, in the seventh century, Mahomet arose
as a self styled Prophet and the creator of Islam-ism. The
doctrine of Islam has <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> dogmas : —
1. Monotheism.
2. Belief in the Prophet, namely Mahomet.
3. The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> of retribution.
The sacred <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> of Islamism, the Koran, was devoid of
mystic teaching. The Figh, for every believer, is the code of
morals and obligations such as fast, prayer, pilgrimage to
Mecca, etc. Mysticism was interjected into Islamism by
Sufism.
Mahomet aimed at the establishment of a religion which,
he declared, was revealed to him during periods of trance
which he frequently underwent. He was determined to
impose this religion on all the Arabs and, through much
bloodshed, he succeeded in stamping out the Koraishites
from whom he <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> Mecca.
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">death</span> of Mahomet was the signal for disruption among
his followers and innumerable divisions both political and
religious, from the history of the Arabs during their periods of
conquest which began immediately after the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">death</span> of
Mahomet during the Khalifate of Omar (634-644).
133

CHAPTER

XVII

UNORTHODOX ISLAM, THE ISHMAELITES, THE
LODGE OF CAIRO

Manicheism was not the only secret association that sprang
from the initiations of the Magi. In the seventh century of our
era we meet with similar societies, possessing an influence
not limited to the regions in which they arose, variations of
one single thought, which aimed at combining the venerable
doctrines of Zoroaster with Christian belief. Of these
societies or sects the following may be mentioned : the
followers of Keyoumerz; the worshippers of Servan, certain
Zoroastrians, so-called " Dualists " ; Gnostics and, lastly, the
followers of Mastek, the most formidable and disastrous of
all, preaching universal equality and liberty, the
irresponsibility of man, and the community of property and
women.
The Arabs having rendered themselves masters of Persia in
the seventh century, the sects of that country <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> to
spread their tenets among Islam in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to undermine it.
This is corroborated by Heckethorn who writes :
" The Persian sects examined the Koran, pointed out its
contradictions, and denied its <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">divine</span> origin. And so

there arose in Islamism that movement which attacks dogmas,

enquiry. " 1
In Persia and in Mesopotamia had spread the new
rationalism, the philosophical heresy of the Mutazi-lites
(schismatics) exposed by Hassan al-Basri.
The Jew Abdallah Ibn Saba 2 presented himself as the
prophet of the future Imam, who was to manifest. He meant
to overthrow the caliphate and to uphold the rights of
Mahomet al-Hanafi, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">son</span> of Ismael, the descendant of the

founded the Shi'a sect.
The Fatmite dynasty (from Fatima, daughter of Mahomet)
was founded in 909 A. D. when Ahmed-Said, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">son</span> of a

Declaring himself to be the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> expected Imam, Said, on
coming to power, assumed the name of Obaid Allah el-Mahdi.
4
The Fatmite dynasty lasted from 909 to 1171. Heckethorn

" Meetings were held in the Lodge at Cairo, which

everything was lawful.

" Egypt, especially, seems as if predestined to be the
birthplace of secret societies, of priests, warriors and fanatics.
It is the region of mysteries... Cairo has succeeded the ancient
Memphis, the doctrine of the Lodge of <span class="t12 t20 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">Wisdom</span> that of the
Academy of Heliopolis... The throne of the descendants of
Fatima was to be surrounded with an army of assassins, a
formidable body-guard; a mysterious militia was to be raised,
that should spread far and wide the fame and terror of the
caliphate of Cairo, and inflict fatal blows on the abhorred rule
of Bagdad. The missionaries spread widely, and in Arabia and
Syria, partisans were won, to whom the designs of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span>
were unknown, but who had with fearful solemnity sworn
blind obedience. "
The Fatmites had received from the sect the mission of
destroying, or at least of disrupting Islam. The successor of
Obaid-Allah continued this work, having himself proclaimed
a Shi'a while in reality he was sceptic. It was under the Caliph
Hakim that the Druses came into being.
The Shi'a sects who recognized Mohammed al-Hanafi as
the last living " Imam " were <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> Ismae-lites or Septimans.
From their midst sprang a secret body, the Khoja, which, in
spite of persecution still exists in Persia and India, where its
exoteric chief is the Anglicised Indian, the Aga Khan, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span>
followers are the moneylenders of Islam, a profession
forbidden by Mahomet.
Still another Shi'a sect, the Duodecimans or Ima-nites,
recognize Mohamed al-Muntazar the twelfth Imam.
Under the Fatmite Caliph Hakim, a new religion sprang out
of Ismailism, that of the Druses, so <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> from its inventor, a
certain Darosi. This religion differs

XVIII

DRUSES

The Druses, as afore stated, are a gnostic sect among the
Ismaelite Mahommedans. It was founded in the tenth century
during the reign of the Fatimite Caliph al-Hakim
Biambellalu.
The founder is usually recognised as Mohammed al Darazi
or al Druzi (Nouchtegin ben Ismail al Bokhari) <span class="t16 t24 hoverable">born</span> near
Bokhara cir. 960. He adopted the doctrine then preached by
al-Hakim of the successive reincarnations of the divinity
under <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> l and wrote a treatise in which he
established the continuous series of <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">divine</span> incarnations
ending with the statement that the last living manifestation
was al-Hakim, the Caliph of Egypt. So pleased was al-Hakim
with the <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> that he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> Mohammed al-Druzi to him, and
gave him <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> authority in the conduct of affairs. From that
time, al-Hakim who hitherto had been known as Biambellalu
that is " the one governing by the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> of God, changed his
name to Biam-Eh <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> " the one governing by his own
right. " He then caused himself to be worshipped as God. The
public reading of Mohammed al-Druzi's book, in one of
Cairo's mosques, •caused popular riots and its author was
obliged to

flee from Egypt. He <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> refuge in the mountains of Syria and

Hamza, later, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">went</span> to Syria and Lebanon and preached to

Profanes, Aspirants and Wise.
The Druses, from a political point of view, are divided into
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> parts, the Djumblatiehs and the Yezbe-kiehs and
religiously they have their own rites, mysteries, and exoteric
and esoteric doctrines. The <span class="t23 hoverable">high</span> initiates or priests rule the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> and through religious fanaticism have reduced the
Druses to a <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> of theocrasy with all its attendant <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> of <span class="t28 hoverable">fear</span>
and numerous restrictions <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> which theocratic <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> can
alone be edified.
In his <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> on Secret Societies, Heckethorn comments on
the similarity existing between the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> of the Druses and that
of the Jews whereby " to a brother, perfect <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> and
confidence are due but it is allowable, nay, a duty, to be false
towards <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span> of another creed. "
Subsequently, he draws <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> another comparison between
the Druses and the Freemasons and mentions the Masonic
degrees of " The United Druses " and " Commanders of
Lebanon ".

XIX

THE ASSASSINS

The Judeo-Shi'a sect of the Assassins or Hashish-ims was
founded in 1090 by Hassan Sabah, a Persian, who had been
initiated into Ismailism at Cairo, in the household of the
Fatimite Caliph, al-Mostansir. He was known as " The Old
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Man</span> " or rather " The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Lord</span> of the Mountain ". His influence in
<span class="t28 hoverable">Egypt</span> having excited the envy of many, he was sent into exile.
Caliph al-Mustansir's " vizir was a Jew named Abu Mansur
Sadakah ibn Yussuf ", l under <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> protection Hassan
traversed Persia as a missionary, preaching and making
proselytes, and, having seized the fortress of Alamut, on the
borders of Irak and Dilem, which he <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> the " <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">House</span> of
Fortune ", he there established his rule.
The history of his <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> is <span class="t5 hoverable">full</span> of his name. Kings in the very
centre of Europe trembled at it; his powerful arm reached
everywhere.
According to Heckethorn, " he reduced the nine degrees
into which the adherents of the Lodge of Cairo were divided
to seven, placing himself at the head, with title of Seydna or
Sidna, whence the Spanish Cid, and the Italian Signore.

THE KNIGHTS TEMPLAR

The first Knights Templar Order, founded in 1118 by Hugh
de Payens, had 13 degrees. So has its modern successor; these
are : —
BLUE DEGREES

1. Entered Apprentice.
2. Fellow Craft.
3. <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> Mason.
<span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">CHAPTER</span> DEGREES

4. Mark Mason.
5. Past Master.
6. Most Excellent Master.
7. Royal Arch.
8. Royal Master.
9. Select Master.
10. Super Excellent Master.
11. Knights of the Red Cross
12. Knights Templar.
13. Knights of Malta.
It is chronicled that several of the founders of the Templar
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Order</span> were initiates in the sect of The Assassins.

Blanchard, writing of it, says : —
" During the middle ages, the most eminent warriors and
noblemen of Europe entered its ranks. The Knights of the Temple
became the bulwark of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Holy</span> <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Land</span> against the Saracens. France,
England and other countries formed associations (Priories) of
Templar Knights, each with its own Grand <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> and other officers.
Such <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> wealth was accumulated in the treasuries of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> that
in the year 1185 its annual income represented a sum equal to thirty
millions of dollars. The Templars were bankers and loaned money
on their own terms. But wealth and prosperity naturally led to
licentiousness, neglect of Templar <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> and in the end destruction.
":
Having embraced Gnosticism while in Palestine, and in touch
with the sect of the Assassins, the Templar <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> degenerated, and
some of its members, under the influence of that sect, were said to
practice Phallicism or sex-worship and Satanism and to venerate "
The Baphomet ", the idol of the Luci-ferians. The crime of Sodomy
was a rite of Templar initiation.
It is here interesting to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">note</span> that the Phallus holds the lowest rank
in Brahmin theology for, in countries where the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> are virtually
enslaved by superstition, this kind of heresy is useful to the ruling
classes.
Morris <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> summarizes the fall of the Templars. " In the year
1307, the Grand <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> of the order, Jacques de Molay, was
arrested in Paris with sixty of his knights and imprisoned <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span>
charges of idolatry and other crimes. Shortly afterward, all the
Knights Templar in France were put in prison in Paris. May 12,
1310, fifty-four of them were burnt alive. March 18, 1314, the

XXII

THE ROSICRUCIANS

Speculation has been rife as to the origin of the
Rosicrucians, and the many fables and legends connected
with the subject have but little historical value.
Owing to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> discrepancy between the information
contained in the following article and that given in the more
modern editions of the Encyclopaedia Britannica, it has been
deemed advisable to reprint the former. (See Enc. Brit., 3r
Edition, Vol. 16, year MDCCXCVII (1797) Edinburgh. Bell
and Macfarquhar.)
" Rosicrucians, a name assumed by a sect or cabal of
hermetical philosophers ; who arose, as it has been said, or at
least became first <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> notice of in Germany, in the
beginning of the fourteenth century. They bound themselves
<span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t6 t9 t11 t15 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">together</span> by a solemn secret, which they all swore inviolably
to preserve : and obliged themselves, at their admission into
the order, to a strict observance of certain established rules.
They pretended to know all sciences, and chiefly medicine :
whereof they published themselves the restorers. They
pretended to be masters of abundance of important secrets,
and, among others, that of the philosopher's stone : all which
they affirmed to have received by tradition from the ancient
Egyptians, Chaldeans, the Magi, and Gymnosophists.
147

148

OCCULT THEOCRASY

They have been distinguished by several names, accommodated to the several branches of their doctrine. Because
they pretend to protect the period of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">human</span> life, by means of
certain nostrums, and even to restore youth, they were <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span>
Immortals ; as they pretended to know all things, they have
been <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> Illuminati; and because they have made no
appearance for several years, unless the sect of Illuminated
which lately started up on the continent derives its origin from
them, they have been <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> the Invisible Brothers. Their
<span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> is frequently signed by the letters F. R. C. which some
among them interpret fratres roris cocti; it being pretended
that the <span class="t25 hoverable">matter</span> of the philosopher's stone is dew concocted,
exalted, etc. Some, who are no friends to free-masonry, make
the present flourishing <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> of free-masons a branch of
Rosicrucians ; or rather the Rosicrucians themselves, under a
new name or relation, viz. as retainers to building. And it is
certain, there are some free-masons who have all the
characters of Rosicrucians ; but how the aera and original of
masonry, and that of Rosicrucianism here fixed
from
Nadaeus, who has <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> expressly on
the subject, conflict, we leave others to judge.....................
Notwithstanding the pretended antiquity of the Rosicrucians,
it is probable that the alchemists, Paracel-sists, ' or
fire-philosophers, who spread themselves through almost all
Europe about the close of the 16th century, assumed about
this period the obscure and ambiguous title of Rosicrucian
brethren, which commanded at first some degree of respect,
as it seemed to be borrowed from the arms of Luther, which
were a cross placed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> a rose. But the denomination

evidently appears to be derived from the science of chemistry. It is

Rosicrucian society, are the following : They all maintain that the
dissolution of bodies, by the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of fire, is the only <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> by which
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span> can arrive at <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">true</span> wisdom, and come to discern the first
principles of things. They all acknowledge a certain analogy and
harmony between the powers of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> and the doctrines of religion ;
and believe that the Deity governs the kingdom of grace by the
same laws with which he rules the kingdom of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">nature</span> ; and hence
they are led to <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> chemical denominations to express the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> of
religion. They all hold that there is a sort of <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">divine</span> energy, or soul,
diffused through the frame of the universe, which some <span class="t3 t11 t18 t27 hoverable">call</span> the
argheus, others the universal spirit, and which others mention under
different appellations. They all talk in the most superstitious

the stars, over all corporeal beings, and their particular influence

This article having been <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> in 1747 only hinted at what
the Rose Croix might have been. Subsequent research <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span>
the organization of the Fraternity, its tenets and its
achievements, shows it to have been a medium for the
propagation of Gnosticism and a centre for political activities.
Before it conquered Freemasonry, which was officially
instituted in 1717, many names were already associated
intimately with this esoteric organization. Among others were
Faustus Socinius, Cesare Cremonini, Michael Maier,
Valentin Andrea, Thomas Vaughan (Philaletes), Charles
Blount, Frede-rich Helvetius, Richard Simon, and Theophilus
Desa-guliers.
It is claimed that Faustus Socinius, named after Faustus,
the Manichee, nephew of Lelius Socinius, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> teacher was
Camillo Renato, was an intimate of Rosicrucianism and the
founder of the Socinians.
Catholics and Protestants alike opposed Faustus Socinius in
his efforts to graft a secret cult on the existing orthodox
religions, and in 1598, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> of Cracovia, revolted by his
doctrines, pillaged his house, burned his books and
manuscripts and almost massacred their author. He had sworn
hatred to the church and busied himself in founding an
association the aims of which were to be subversive to all its
teachings, and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> before his death, he was obliged to
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">take</span> refuge from his enemies with one Abraham Blonski.
The membership of the Rose Croix was composed of
Alchemists, Astrologers and Spiritists <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> quest was the
search for a process for transmuting base metals into gold and
the secret of life. To most of these " generation was the
root principle of Achemy. " 3
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> of the Rose Croix revealed itself in 1614

In this legend, translated into English in 1616 by Robert

The hall still contained lamps burning <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> fuel, mirrors of

fulfilled, adds the fable, by <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">way</span> of conclusion.

OCCULT THEOCRASY

The movement was greatly furthered by the impulse given
it when, after the appearance of the Fama Frater-nitatis and
Confessio, a German Alchemist, Michael Maier, an English
Physician, Robert Fludd and a Pietist, Julius Sperber, wrote
treatises in defence or explanation of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> of the Rose
Croix.
It has repeatedly been stated that Michael Maier, who
frequently visited England, was a friend of Robert Fludd. He
was the author of Themis Aurea and Silentium post Clamores,
both Rosicrucian works. His political influence may be
judged from his career. Physician to Rudolf II, he was <span class="t16 hoverable">created</span>
by him Count of the Palatinate, and acted as adviser to his
sovereign. In 1609, Rudolf II issued an Imperial Charter
granting religious liberty to the Moravians.5
Masonic authorities <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> that Maier, as a Rosicrucian,
changed his official title to Summus Magister, Sovereign
Master, which is that <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> by all his successors and borne by
the principal Socinian Rose-Croix documents, dating from
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of Faustus Socinius to that of Johann Wolff, which
are preserved in the Sovereign Patriarchal Council of
Hamburg. (That is the Supreme Jewish Lodge secretly
affiliated to International Masonry.)
In his <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> Themis Aurea, <span class="t0 t11 t24 hoverable">written</span> in 1616 and 1617 and
printed in 1618, Maier, the Grand Master, refers to a
resolution passed at a meeting in 1617 in which it was
formally agreed that the Brotherhood of the Rose Croix must
maintain the strictest secrecy for a hundred years. On October
31 1617, the Convention of the Seven at Magdebourg had
indeed agreed to qualify its members during the ensuing one
hundred <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span>
5. Hastings, Encyclopaedia of Religions and Ethics. Art. Hussites.

THE

ROSICRUCIANS

153

of secrecy as " The Invisibles ". It had renewed its oath to
destroy the church of <span class="t0 t6 t8 t9 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t22 t23 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Jesus</span> <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> and had decreed that, in the
year 1717, it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> transform the fraternity into an
association which could carry on a more or less open
propaganda, while adopting such meas-sures of prudence as
might then be deemed expedient by the leaders of the sect.
Finally, the Seven adopted definitely, as being sufficiently
original to appeal to the popular imagination, Valentin
Andrea's curious story of the Rose Croix which had been
secretly print-ted in Venice towards 1613.
Robert Fludd was the author of Tractatus Apologe-ticus
(1617) and Clavis Philosophiae et Alchymiae (1633). He was
greatly helped in the foundation of the Rose Croix <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> in
England by Francis Bacon, author of Nova Atlantis 6 (1624).
Valentin Andrea to whom, as we have seen, are ascribed
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t25 t29 hoverable">works</span> Fama and Confessio, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as Che-mycal
Nuptials, had, in 1640, been appointed preacher to the Duke
of Brunswick Wolfenbuttel, who was soon to make him his
chaplain.
To those who know the important part played by a Duke of
Brunswick during the French Revolution, this entrance of the
Brunswick family into the sect is very interesting. As a
Rosicrucian, Andrea was the teacher of Comenius (Amos
Kominsky), who frequently visited England during his
mysterious political career. Bishop of a Moravian community,
Comenius was the leader of the Moravian Brethren, a sect
pledged to achieve the extermination of the Catholic church
and which, being considered heretical, was also suspected of
practising secret satanism. The Moravians were imbued with
Socinianism, that is the doctrine of Lelius
6

Wittemans, Histoire des Rose Croix, p. 71.
