It is a common error to believe that the Enghsn Grand
Lodge is an independent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> which was formed in 1717.
Logical deduction will show that, owing to its formation
being the result of Rosicrucian effort, it always has been, and
still must be, subject to the direction of its esoteric parent
body, i. e. ROSICRUCIA-NISM or Manichean and Socinian
Gnosticism.
Childish as may be the claim of English Grand Lodge as to
its autonomy and independence, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">yet</span> it has been most
successfully defended by scores of English writers who
attacked Masonic Societies and their subversive activities
against <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> and religion. According to them English Grand
Lodge was always exempted from such groups.
It is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> to put an end to this legend. English Grand Lodge,
the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> which claims to represent English Freemasonry, is
as much the child of Rosicrucianism today as it was in 1717
and has no more <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> or wish today to rebel against, or deny
its parent, than it had then. As to Esoteric Rosicrucianism,
this Esoteric body, mainly Cabalistic in its direction, always
has been and is in <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">truth</span> international. It has penetrated every
association, <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> or organization just as did the Illuminati
of Bavaria at the Wilhelmsbad convent of 1782.
In the particular Gnostic Rosicruciana in Anglia, briefly
sketched here, we see internationalism clearly depicted. At
one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> it was personified in Kenneth Mackenzie who,

LXXXVIII

THE CLAN-NA-GAEL (V. C.)
(Founded 1869)
In his oft quoted book, The Secret Societies of Ireland,
Captain H. B. C. Pollard, late of the Staff of the Chief of
Police, Ireland, gives much valuable information concerning
the Clan-na-Gael (See page 69 et seq.).
" In 1869 a new secret Irish-American organization was
formed, known as the Clan-na-Gael. It traces its origin back
through a permanent secret <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> known as the Knights of
the Inner Circle, which, in turn, descended from the Knights
of St. Patrick, known as the Ancient <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Order</span> of Hibernians
to-day. It was originally a seceding circle (The Brian Boru) of
the United Irishmen, an American <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> tracing back
to 1789. "
By 1873, the Clan had absorbed all independent Irish secret
societies save that of " The Irish Confederation " of Jeremiah
O'Donovan Rossa with which it had reached an arrangement
for mutual toleration.
" The original organizer of the Clan had <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> it the United
Brotherhood, and in all its <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> a simple letter cipher
composed of the next letter in the alphabet after the one really
meant, was utilised. The secret name of the Clan being the
United Brotherhood, it was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">therefore</span> designated and spoken
of as the V. C.

" An open Irish movement had been evolving in the States 2
and a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> Irish Convention was held at Chicago in

the Clan secured the office of Chairman to one of its members,
the Rev. George Betts, and as he had the right of appointment
of all members of committees, they were enabled to nominate
a Clan-na-Gael majority and force the Clan views on the
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> of the Convention.
" In 1882 the Clan, which had for <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">long</span> controlled the secret
organization in America, now also controlled all the various

<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span> co-ordinated political <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of the Irish organizations
in America. The process developed by the I. R. B. in Ireland
was analogous ; through its members they were represented
on the Committees and Councils of practically every
organization which, in the opinion of its leaders, could be of
<span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> to it. The identity of the I. R. B. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">men</span> was always a secret.
" The secret <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of the Brotherhood was <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> to bear
on all questions of appointment to positions and offices in
various open associations, and it was its influence and
corruption which achieved those mysterious appointments to
position of persons singularly devoid of merit, which were,
and are, a marked feature of Irish life...
" In so far as the activist military policy of the I. R. B. was
concerned, the period from 1895 to 1912 was practically
negative.

LXXXIX

NIHILISTS

(Founded 1869)

The Nihilists were founded in the spring of 1869 by
Netchaief who had adopted the views of social organization
which have found expression in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t24 t25 t29 hoverable">works</span> of Proudhon and
Abbe Constant.
As anarchists, they embraced the usual anarchist ideals
some of which, such as " property is theft ", and " <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">death</span> to
Tyrants ", could be useful to other organizations.

THE CRYPTIC RITE

Introduced into England in 1871 from America under the
authority of the Grand Council of New York, the Grand
Mastership was awarded by the Grand Council to the Rev. G.
R. Portal, M. A., in 1873.

CHAPTER

XCIII

ANARCHISTS

(Founded 1872)

Anarchists claim direct descent from Diderot and those
factions which during the French Revolution of 1789 had
formed the clubs of the Enrages and Hebertistes. Prudhon
was their prototype.
Chronologically speaking, however, the Anarchist party
was formed on Sept. 29, 1872, when a split occurred in the
ranks of the participants in the Hague Congress of the
International Association of Workers, numbers siding with
Bakunin whilst others rallied round Karl Marx.
Bakunin's adherents formed the Anarchist party and
organized in Switzerland the " Federation Juras-sienne "
which soon extended its ramifications to Northern Italy,
Eastern France and Spain. The Federation's tenets were
plainly anarchistic, urging terrorism as the means of
overthrowing all forms of existing governments. The attempt
of Haedel on the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of the German Emperor Wilhelm in 1878,
as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as the murder of the Tzar Alexander II of Russia, 1882,
were engineered by anarchists. From Europe, their activities
spread to the United States of America when Most, the
German anarchist, founder of the Freiheit, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">went</span>
526

THE

ANARCHISTS

527

to New York and, with Julius Schwab, organized the
Anarchist movement in America, founding the Socialist and
Revolutionary Club of New York in 1880 and such press
organs as The Anarchists of Boston, later followed by Liberty.
The methods of these societies are identical with those of the
I. W. W., the " Industrial Workers of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">World</span> ".
For root of this movement see <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">Chapter</span> LXXXV.
For development of this movement see <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">Chapter</span> CXXV.

THE ANCIENT AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">ORDER</span> OF
DRUIDS
(Founded 1874)

Founded by Bros. R. Wentworth Little, W. Hyde Pullen
and Thomas Massa, in 1874, this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> is restricted to
members of the Masonic <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> only.

CHAPTER
THE

THEOSOPHICAL

XCV
<span class="t1 hoverable">SOCIETY</span>

(Founded 1875)
The Theosophical Society, with nine degrees, was founded
in 1875 by Helena Petrovna Blavatsky (1831-1891) daughter
of Colonel Peter Hahn and granddaughter of General Alexis
Hahn von Rottenstern Hahn, of Mecklenburg, Germany,
settled in Russia. When very young, she married Niciphore
Blavatsky, Councillor of State, from whom she separated
after <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> months.
As regards the founder of this order, Rene Guenon, who
has made a close study of Theosophy, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> briefly sketches
her career.
" Mme. Blavatsky's extraordinary <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> of adventure started
in 1848. During her travels in. Asia Minor with her friend
Countess Kiseleff, she met a Copt (some say a Chaldean)
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> Paulos Metamon, who claimed to be a magician, and

Having quarrelled with her family, she was unable to go to

About this period, (1856) her Mahatma Morya is supposed
first to have manifested. The Mahat-mas Morya and Koot
Hoomi are said to be members of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">highest</span> degree of "The

was with Garibaldi, whom she accompanied during his

she was seriously wounded and <span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span> on the field as dead ; she

PRIMITIVE AND ORIGINAL PHREMASONS
(SWEDENBORGIAN RITE)

(Founded 1876)

Known as the Rite of Primitive and Original Phremasons,
The Supreme Grand Lodge and Temple of the
Swedenborgian Rite received its charter on 1/10/1876 from
the Supreme Council of the Phremasons in Canada (founded
by the Golden Square <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Body</span> of London) which was composed
of the following well-known Brethren :
M. N. Brother Colonel W. J. B. McLeod Moore S. G. M.,
Grand <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> of Templars and 33° R W. Brother T. D.
Harrington, S. G. S. W., Pt. G. M. of
the Grand Lodge of Canada and 33° R W.
Brother George Canning Longley. 33°
The officers of the Supreme Council for England then
appointed were :— M. W. Brother John Yarker. S. G. M. R W.
Brother Captain R G Irwin. S. G S. W. R W. Brother Captain
Chas. Scott J. P., S. G J. W. Supreme Grand Secretary Dr. K.
R. H. Mackenzie.
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Upon</span> the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">death</span> of Scott and the retirement of Irwin, Dr.

XCVII

THE NATIONAL <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">LAND</span> LEAGUE
(Founded 1879)
On Oct. 21,' 1879, this organization was established at
Dublin, Ireland, with Charles Stewart Parnell as its President.
It cooperated closely with the Clan-na-Gael. Among its
members were Egan, the treasurer, Biggar, Dillon, J. J.
O'Kelly, London and Harris. The league was responsible for
many agrarian outrages and in October, Parnell, Sexton, Kelly,
Wm. O'Brien and Michael Davitt were arrested and
imprisoned. From jail they issued a manifesto advising all
tenants to pay no rent. On Oct. 18, 1881 the Government
suppressed the <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Land</span> League.
The American branch of the National <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Land</span> League was
founded in 1880.
For root of this movement see <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">Chapter</span> LXXXVIII.

CHAPTER

XCVIII

THE RUSSELLITES
OR THE INTERNATIONAL BIBLE STUDENTS

(Founded 1879)
The International Bible Student Movement was founded by
Charles Taze Russell (1852-1916) with the <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> chiefly of
attracting the lower middle class intelligentsia of Christian
communities such as certain clerical workers, teachers,
servants and persons not accessible to direct forms of
propaganda. In America the movement has had <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
influence among the negro element.
In 1879 Russell founded The Watch Tower of which he
was the sole editor.
The Russellite teaching, drawing its own arbitrary
conclusions and proclaiming them as final, professes to prove
from Biblical sources that all Christian churches are <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> and

CII

THE AHMADIYYAH SECT
(Founded 1882)
The ahmadiyyah sect is described in an article by Fr.
Lawrence as having been founded in 1882 at Quadiam,
Punjab, by Mirza Ghulam Ahmad, who died in 1908. It
resembles in many ways Bahaism and attempts to conciliate
the oriental and occidental religions while its dogma, based
on the shi'a (unorthodox Mahometan) foundation of <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span>
thought, embraces the buddhist belief, rites and
metempsychosis as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as the idea of the occult Messiah.
In accordance with the Ismali theory of the advent of the
reincarnated mahdi at the opening of each century, this sect
proclaims their founder to have been the reincarnation of
<span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> for the XIV Century (XX of our era) and the harbinger
of the future Messiah.
An Indian branch of the sect endorses a legend according
to which Christ, having escaped the Pharisees, died at
Srinagar, Kashmir. At this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> is the tomb of an obscure
buddhist saint Yus-asaf.
The propaganda of the sect is worked from <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> centres, one
at Lahore, India, and the other at Woking, England, the latter
being chiefly political in character adhering to the kemalist
and panturanic programme.

CIV

KNIGHTS OF COLUMBUS
(Founded 1882)
The Knights of Columbus is the name of a Roman Catholic
organization founded in 1882, in the United States of
America, by a Roman Catholic priest, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Father</span> P. McGivney of
New Haven, Connecticut.
From the Roman Catholic paper, La Croix, of Paris, in the
<span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> dated December 20, 1913, we gather that, at that date,
the Knights of Columbus wielded an immense <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> with
which public authorities had to reckon. Their <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> then
was acknowledged to be more than <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> hundred thousand.
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Order</span> had four degrees and was headed by a Grand
Master, six pro-Grand Masters and a General Secretary. The
territory of the United States was divided into six provinces,
each province administered by one of the six pro-Grand
Masters. Each province was in turn subdivided in districts
administered by a <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t12 t17 t19 t20 t27 t29 hoverable">Master</span> of the 4th degree and appointed by
the Grand Masters for a period of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> years. Districts were
subdivided in councils or chapters.
The Verite of Quebec, a Canadian paper, in August 1913,
put the <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of the councils at 1630. At that time, the
Supreme Council of the Knights of Columbus was composed
of James O'Flaherty, Martin H. Carmody,
550

OF COLUMBUS

William J. McGinley, Daniel J. Callahan and Joseph C.
Pelletier.
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> of the Knights of Columbus was the cause of
much perturbation in the Roman Catholic Church.
Under cover of being an association for mutual help, it had
recruited a considerable <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of members whc believed
that the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Order</span> was fully approved by the Church authorities.
When however its activities <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> on the appearance of a
Masonic <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> with initiation rituals, symbolism and secret
oaths, many among the Catholic Clergy became alarmed.
Their fears were not allayed when it was known that the
leaders of the Knights of Columbus were having fraternal
exchanges of all kinds with the Oddfellows, Templars and
other Masonic bodies. The climax was reached when it was
rumoured that in Rome, the Knights of Columbus had
petitioned the Pope to allow their members to become, at least
in the United States, regular Masons.
The Knights of Columbus, like the Oddfellows, formed
lodges of adoption in 1913, women being enrolled under the
caption of " Daughters of Isabella ". Women lodges were
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> " courts ". In 1913, the <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of " courts " was over
200 and the membership of " Daughters of Isabella " over <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span>
hundred thousand.
Like the <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> of Oddfellows and similarly to the O. T. O.
of the Rosicrucians the Knights of Columbus hold much
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> over the property and various interests of their
members.
Due to their efforts in the direction of establishing a
universal religion and inter-confessionalism, the Knights of
Columbus have been considered by a large section of the
Roman Catholic clergy as an element having departed from
the teachings of the Church of Rome and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> secret aim is
to bore from <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> and disintegrate the Roman Catholic
power.

Although the Knights of Columbus and the Daughters of
Isabella have extended their ramifications into the United
Kingdom, it is in the United States that their strength mainly
resides. This is easily understood when one studies the
activities of Roman Catholics in America and realises that,
there, they are far more a political entity with subversive
tendencies than a religious body.

CHRISTIAN SCIENCE
(Founded 1883)
Christian Science was founded in 1883.
Mary Baker Eddy, the founder, was <span class="t16 t24 hoverable">born</span> in 1821 at Bow,
New Hampshire, U. S. A. and died in 1910.
Having suffered greatly all her <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> from neurasthenia and
hysteria she developed mediumship at an early age. Spiritistic
sessions further revealed her psychic gifts but it is more than
likely that her early <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> of experimental psychic research
exposed her, in after years, to the horrors of what she later
described as " Malicious Animal Magnetism ", familiarly
referred to by her students as M. A. M.
At the age of 22, she married George Washington Glover, a
Freemason and Oddfellow, who <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> her to live at Charleston,
South Carolina, six months later. However he contracted
yellow fever while at Wilmington where he died in June 1844.
In 1853, she married Daniel Patterson, a medical
practitioner, from whom she was later separated.
In October 1862 she applied for medical assistance to
Phineas Parkhurst Quimby (d. 1866) a healer, who had many
marvellous cures to his credit. His medical system was based
on an understanding of the scientific laws
553

554

OCCULT THEOCRASY

governing the <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of hypnotism, mesmerism and suggestion.
It is claimed that she derived her system from him.
Her <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> Science and Health was first published in 1875.
In 1877 she married Asa Gilbert Eddy who <span class="t3 t13 t18 t24 hoverable">left</span> her a
widow in 1882.
In 1881, she founded the Massachusetts Metaphysical
College in Boston and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> later, when the movement
was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> established, started publishing the Christian
Science Journal.
On June 13, 1888, the National Christian Science
Association held its <span class="t2 t3 t5 t10 t12 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">second</span> annual meeting at Central Music
Hall, Chicago. This had been organized as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> as advertised
by George B. Day, Pastor of the First Church of <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span>
Scientists, Chicago, and the speech delivered by Mrs. Eddy
on the <span class="t2 t3 t5 t10 t12 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">second</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">day</span> of this session was acclaimed by her 4,000
listeners as an inspired oration. In <span class="t1 t2 t19 hoverable">view</span> of the extraordinary
pitch of enthusiasm attained by her audience and knowing the
practice of " charging" public rooms or halls one is led to ask
oneself the question as to <span class="t10 t12 t16 t20 t21 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whether</span> the assembly hall had been
specially "charged" for that particular meeting. <span class="t10 t12 t16 t20 t21 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">Whether</span> Mrs.
Eddy herself, like the Sybils of ancient times, was also "
inspired" by outside hypnotic influence is another hypothesis
to conjure with.
From then on, Mrs. Eddy's religious future was assured.
Under her leadership suggestion became indeed the
foundation of a religion, a religion in which psychic force,
operating under suggestion, accomplishes definite <span class="t1 hoverable">physical</span>
results.
Mrs. Eddy's acquaintance with Mrs. Augusta Stetson,
another Christian Science leader, had already <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> for,
according to E. F. Dakin, author of Mrs. Eddy {page 178) "it
was at a meeting in a fashionable home on

Monument Hill in Charleston that she first met Augusta

she shrouded her past in mystery, refused -to tell her age, and

and of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span> matter, like force, is but one manifestation
or expression in the midst of many. "
Mrs. Stetson started healing and teaching Mrs. Eddy's
system in New York in 1886, later resigning her connection
with the Christian Science church in 1909.
One can almost describe this system as emerging clearly
out of the realm of occultism, a kind of suggestion or
auto-suggestion, whereby practical beneficial results may be
induced in a patient by the application of certain occult laws
to their personal medical requirements.
Mrs. Eddy's dogma is summed up by Hudson in the
following <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">words</span> :
" <span class="t25 hoverable">Matter</span> has no existence. Our bodies are composed of
matter, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">therefore</span> our bodies have no existence.

<span class="t28 hoverable">fear</span> of the action of Malicious Animal Magnetism, so derided

These forces operate on sound scientific lines and those
who can <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of suggestion to gain ascendency over

That danger is real and every student of the occult knows it.
The movement has become popular and has a following

THE FABIAN <span class="t1 hoverable">SOCIETY</span>
(Founded 1883)
The nominal founder of The Fabian <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> was Thomas
Davidson, an idealist who, in the hope of bettering the lot of
humanity, organized a debating club the original aim of
which was, according to Mr. Pease, author of The History of
the Fabian Society, " the reconstruction of <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> on a
non-competitive basis with the <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> of remedying the evils
of poverty. " l
This non-competitive basis meant maintenance for all by
the community as a right, regardless of merit.
The club met fortnightly in the drawing rooms of its
various members and in 1884 adopted the name "The Fabian
Society".
Among those prominent in the movement in its early <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t6 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 hoverable">days</span>
were : Frank Podmore, a spiritualist, Percival Chubb, a clerk
on the Local Government Board, Edward Pease, Hubert
Bland, J. Ramsay Macdonald, later Prime Minister of
England, R. B. Haldane, afterwards <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Lord</span> Haldane, George
Bernard Shaw, Sidney Webb, afterwards <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Lord</span> Passfield,
Graham Wallas, William Clarke, a former disciple of Mazzini,
Mrs. Annie Besant, then a radical with an office at 63, Fleet
Street, who
1. See page 37 et seq.

558

controlled The Freethought Publishing Co., Dr. Pank-hurst,
husband of the later leader of the Women's Social and Political
Union and Mrs. Charlotte M. Wilson who, while retaining her
membership in the Fabian <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> " devoted herself ", so we are told
by Mr. Pease, to the Anarchist movement led by Prince Kropotkin
and for some <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> edited the anarchist paper Freedom. On page 68
of The History of the Fabian <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> by Edward R. Pease we read :
" In <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to avoid a breach with Mrs. Wilson and her Fabian
sympathisers, it was resolved to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> a Fabian Parliamentary

" The League will <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">take</span> active part in all general and local
elections. Until a fitting opportunity arises for putting forward
Socialist candidates to <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> the nucleus of a Socialist party in
Parliament, it will confine itself to supporting those candidates who
will go furthest in the direction of Socialism. It will not ally itself
absolutely with any political party; it Will jealously avoid being
made <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of for party purposes ; and it will be guided in its action by
the character, record and pledges of the candidates before the
constituencies. In Municipal, School Board, Vestry, and other local
elections, the League will, as it finds itself strong enough, run
candidates of its own, and by placing trustworthy Socialists on local
representative bodies it will endeavour to-secure the recognition of
the Socialist principle in all the details of local government. "...
" The League first faded into a Political Committee of the Society,
and then merged silently and painlessly into the general body. "
The foregoing is interesting : first, — as showing the original
Anarchist connection with Fabian Socialism

as we now know it, secondly, — as an example of one of the

An offshoot of the existing organization was here formed,
pledged to a policy or policies which might have been
repudiated by the parent body. This offshoot being destined to
eventual reabsorption into the parent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">body</span> could <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> assure

We are further told by Mr. Pease that in 1888, " a
Universities Committee, with Frank Podmore as Secretary for
Oxford and G. W. Johnson for Cambridge, had begun the '
permeation ' of the Universities, which has always been an
important part of the propaganda of the <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> ".
By 1890, the support of a splendidly organized intelligentsia was assured to the socialist cause with the Fabian
<span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> as its propaganda centre and a <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of local Fabian
societies were formed. They were succeeded by and merged
into branches of the Independent Labour Party.
On page 209 of Mr. Pease's book, we glean some more
enlightening information which definitely connects the
Fabians with the Jew-captured organization of the old
International
" The International Socialist and Trade Union Congresses,
held at intervals of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">three</span> or four <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> since 1889, were at first
no more than isolated Congresses, arranged by local

Each nation voted as one, or at most, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">two</span> units, and
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">therefore</span> no limit was placed on the <span class="t3 t17 t26 hoverable">number</span> of delegates ; the

Germany. But gradually the organization was tightened up,
and in 1907 a scheme was adopted

which gave twenty votes each to the leading nations, and
proportionately fewer to the others. Moreover a permanent
Bureau was established at Brussels, with Emile Vandervelde,
the distinguished leader of the Belgian Socialists, later <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span>

to raise the British quota of the cost of the Bureau, and to elect
and instruct the British delegates. It was decided by the
Brussels Bureau that the 20 British votes should be allotted ;
10 to the Labour Party, 4 to the I. L. P. (Independent Labour
Party) 4 to the British Socialist Party, into which the old S. D.
F. (Socialist Democratic Federation) had merged, and 2 to the
Fabian Society, and the British Section of the International
Socialist Bureau was, and still remains, constituted financially
and electorally on that basis. "
In the same <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">chapter</span> of his history, Mr. Pease explains that "
half of two-thirds of the Fabians belonged also to the I. L. P.
and nearly all the I. L. P. leaders were or had been members of
the Fabian <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> ". The I. L. P. was founded in January
1893 by Keir Hardie and Fried-rich Engels, the disciple of
Karl Marx.
This Independent Labour Party virtually <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> over the

HERMETIC <span class="t1 hoverable">SOCIETY</span>
(Founded 1884)
This spiritistic <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> was founded in London on May 9,
1884, by Anna Kingsford and Edward Maitland, both
members of the Theosophical Society.
According to R. Guenon, it advocates a Gnostic mixture
of Christianity and Buddhism.
For Anna Kingsford, as for Mme Blavatsky, the Christs are
<span class="t1 t4 t8 t16 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">beings</span> who have succeeded in developing in themselves
certain superior powers latent in all men. This is presumably
the " Serpent <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Power</span> " or Kundalini, the Sex Force. <span class="t0 t6 t8 t9 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t22 t23 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Jesus</span> is
not the historical personage <span class="t0 t6 t8 t9 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t22 t23 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Jesus</span> Christ. <span class="t0 t6 t8 t9 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t22 t23 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Jesus</span> is only an
initiate, one of " the Christs " incarnating through the ages in
different bodies, other incarnations of the " <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> force "
having been in the persons of Maitreya Bouddha, Krishna and
the various prophets of the other religions.
As a foundation for a Universal <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">World</span> Religion, the idea is
a clever one but its consequences are that anyone who makes
enough fuss about himself can become a god, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> reducing
the idea ad absurdum.
This is the principle which when further elaborated leads
to the usual Gnostic belief that " <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Man</span> is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> ".
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Man</span> being <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">thus</span> infallible therefore, as <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span>

Modern Illuminism, as we know it, was founded by Karl Kellner
in 1895. He died in 1905 and was succeeded by Theodore Reuss, the
agent of John Yarker.

connection is further explained in the article on Societas
Rosicruciana in Anglia in <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">Chapter</span> LXXXVII.

The conception of the O. T. O. was far from being original

CXI

THEOSOPHIGAL <span class="t1 hoverable">SOCIETY</span> OF AMERICA
(Founded 1895)

In November 1894 William Q. Judge rebelled against Mrs.
Besant's domination of The Theosophical Society.
On April 27th, 1895, he and his followers seceded from the
Adyar <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> and constituted an independent organization
under the name " Theosophical <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> of America ". This
organization, which still exists, has its headquarters at
Point-Loma, California, It was first presided over by Ernest
Hargrove and later by Katherine A. Tingley. It has branches
in Sweden and Holland.
Katherine A. Tingley, known to her followers as " The
Purple Mother ", was in touch with Bro. Theodore Reuss,
Magus Supremus in Mundo of the Esoteric Rosicrucians.
This sect it appears, practises Raja Yoga.
Parents desirous of having their <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">children</span> <span class="t0 t4 t6 t8 t9 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t19 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">brought</span> up under
its aegis must forfeit all their natural rights of inquiry
concerning their children's welfare, this prohibition extending
even to their right to assist at lessons.
Pupils <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> education has been entrusted to the
582

sect are taught to observe absolute secrecy towards their
parents as regards matters concerning the school.
Notwithstanding such subversive rules the school is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span>
attended.

THE YOUNG TURK MOVEMENT
(Founded 1900)
Not till 1900, when the Grand Orient virtually <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span> over
the Young Turk Party which was composed chiefly of Jews,
Greeks and Armenians, did this movement assume a serious
aspect.
Vicomte Leon de Poncins in The Secret Powers behind the
Revolution (page 66) giving the history and origin of the
Young Turk Movement adds the following information <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span>
from the Masonic organ of the Grand Orient, The Acacia
(October 1908).
" A secret Young Turk council was formed and the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span>
movement was directed from Salonica.
Salonica, the most Jewish town in Europe — 70,000 Jews
out of a population of 100,000 — was specially suitable for
the purpose. It already contained several Lodges in which the
revolutionaries could <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> being disturbed. These
Lodges are under the protection of European diplomacy and
as the Sultan was <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span> weapons against them his fall was
inevitable. "
He further adds : —
" The Young Turks entered these lodges and met

CHAPTER

CXIV

THE AMSTERDAM INTERNATIONAL
(Founded 1901)
The International Federation of Trade Unions, not to be
confused with The <span class="t2 t3 t5 t10 t12 t18 t19 t21 t24 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">Second</span> International, was founded at
Copenhagen in 1901.
It ceased to function during the War, but was reestablished
as The Amsterdam International in 1919.
Its objects include the following :
To unite the international working class.
To promote the interests and activities of the trade union
movement.
The development of international social legislation.
To avert war and combat reaction.
For root of this movement see <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">Chapter</span> LXXXV.

STELLA MATUTINA
(Founded 1903)

The foundation of Stella Matutina, with Aleister Crowley
and Wm. Wynn Westcott at its head, was the result of a split

(Founded 1905)

Sinn Fein, an Irish patriotic organization advocating
boycott and passive resistance against England was founded
by Arthur Griffiths in 1905. He was succeeded as president in
1917 by Eamon de Valera. By that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> the <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> was

as the open foe of England.
Richard Dawson in Red Terror and Green, page 176,
publishes a despatch sent to Count von Bernstorff, the
German Ambassador in the United States at that date. The
document was marked " very secret " and dated April 18,
1916. It reads as follows :
" Judge Cohalan (of New York, U. S. A.) requests the
transmission of the following remarks : The revolution in
Ireland can only be successful with the support of Germany :
otherwise England will be able to suppress it, even <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">though</span> it
be only after a hard struggle. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Therefore</span> helpis necessary. This
should consist principally of aerial attacks on England and a
diversion of the fleet simultaneously with the Irish revolution.
Then if possible a landing of arms and ammunition in

CHAPTER

CXXI

THE ANTHROPOSOPHICAL <span class="t1 hoverable">SOCIETY</span>
(Founded 1913)
The Anthroposophical Society, an offshoot of the
Theosophical Society, was founded on Jan 14, 1913. by
Rudolph Steiner, who had been secretary of the Theosophical
<span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> of Germany in Berlin since 1902.
Mr. Edouard Schure, the author of the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> known <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span>
Les Grands Inities, deserted Mrs. Besant and The
Theosophical <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> at the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> of the schism and followed
Steiner into the Anthroposophical Society. Later, however,
he reverted also to his old allegiance.
Soon after its <span class="t1 t2 t3 t5 t9 t12 t15 t16 t17 t19 t22 t24 t25 t26 hoverable">creation</span> it practically merged with the
Theosophical Society.
Stsiner was a friend of Dr. Hubbe Schleiden, the Secretary
General of the German Theosophical <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> and President
of several German secret societies, the Druidenorden, Black
Templars, Rosicrucians, Ygdrasil.
The headquarters of the cult and its chief temple " The
Goetheaneum" are at Dornach, Switzerland. This building, a
crude " Noah's Ark " specimen of architecture, flaunts the
symbol of the cult above its main portal, while <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> its
precincts the <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of the iod (see Appendix, <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t16 t17 t18 t19 t21 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">Chapter</span> on
Symbolism) as a decorative motif further emphasizes its
esoteric phallic dedication.

" I don't believe that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">God</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> approve of some of your
practices, and I think your statement is an outrageous and
sacrilegious thing. That's how I feel about it ! "

were 77,351 arrests for violations, alleged or real. During the

and during the last fiscal year there were close to 70,000.
Demand for more prisons has been made and new ones
ordered, which it is said will not give relief from overcrowding except for a period of 5 <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> or possibly 10. Prison

THE AMERICAN CIVIL LIBERTIES UNION
(Founded 1920)
In 1924, a <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> by R. M. Whitney <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span> The Reds in
America made its appearance. The American Civil Liberties
Union founded by Upton Sinclair had by that <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> become an
important branch of the <span class="t7 hoverable">Third</span> International so Mr. Whitney
gave several pages to a description of its organization and
methods. All these <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> be quoted here were it not that
space forbids. Our chief <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> in including this minor <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span>
among those already mentioned is to show the methods
whereby Communism is rendered palatable to those <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">world</span> it <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">would</span> destroy.
" The American Civil Liberties Union owes its <span class="t11 t16 hoverable">existence</span> to
the notorious pacifist organizations of war-time fame, which
were presumably financed by German agents in this country
working desperately, and for a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">time</span> successfully, to keep the
United States from entering the war. To be sure, in its present
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> it has existed only since January 12, 1920, when it was
formed as an outgrowth and with the merging of various
organizations which were developed during the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">World</span> War,
dating from October, 1914, and the members of which were
pacifists, defeatists, German agents, radicals of many hues,
communists, I. W. W. and Socialists. Among the

" The activities of this organization are extensive. It assists

in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to influence public sympathy toward the radical

from within" in churches, religious and labour organizations,
Women's Clubs, schools and colleges and the American
Federation of Labour, in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to spread radical ideas. The
union maintains a staff of speakers, investigators and lawyers
who are working in all sections of the country. Lawyers are
furnished on short notice wherever a radical criminal gets into
trouble. A press clipping service is maintained which keeps
the organization in close touch with every radical criminal or
group of radical criminals in trouble and immediate financial
aid, publicity and counsel is offered. Aiding in this service are
some 800 co-operating lawyers, and more than a <span class="t15 t23 hoverable">thousand</span>
correspondents and investigators, representing 450 weekly
labour, farmer and liberal papers with 420 speakers and
writers.

active in aiding the Communists caught in the Bridgman,
Mich., raid.

Mr. Whitney quotes the following paragraphs from the
1920 Lusk Committee report concerning the American Civil
Liberties Union :
" An examination, however, of the propaganda and
agitation which has been carried on in favor of the forceful
overthrow of this Government shows that it does not consist
of a mere expression of opinion, but invariably advocates
measures for its effectuation. In other words, the
representatives of revolutionary Socialists, Communists,
Anarchists and other groups, <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> that by doing certain acts
this Government may be overthrown and in each instance the
agitator urges his hearers or his readers to commit those acts.
It is a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">well</span> settled principle of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">law</span> that any reasonable <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> is
responsible for the logical and reasonable consequences of
his acts and utterances.
" While the Constitution of the <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">State</span> of New York
guarantees the right of <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> speech it also contains the
warning that the citizen may exercise it " being responsible
for the abuse of that right ". The effect of the activities of the
American Civil Liberties Union is to create in the minds of
the ill-informed <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> the impression that it is un-American
to interfere with the activities of those who seek to destroy
American institutions. They seek to influence legislators and
executives to repeal or veto any act calculated to protect the
<span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">State</span> or the Federal Government from the attacks of
agitators. "

THE V. V. V.
VEREINIGUNG VERGEWALTIGTER VOLKER.

(Founded 1920)
The origin of this <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> is given by Mrs. Webster in The
Surrender of an Empire (p. 132) in the following terms :
" The League of Oppressed Peoples had been founded in
the United States under the name of the ' League of Small and
Subject Nationalities ' by Dudley Field Malone, attorney for
Ludwig Martens, who was afterwards appointed Bolshevist
ambassador to the United States by Chicherin. Aleister
Crowley, the well-known Satanist, who was then working in
the United States for Germany, was connected with this
association through one of its agents in America... After the
Armistice the <span class="t1 hoverable">society</span> became the ' League of Oppressed
Peoples ', a name coined by the Germans who had declared
themselves to be the champions of the numerous oppressed
peoples of the British Empire ".
In the archives of certain Secret Services, there is a report
stating that John Wesley De Kay, having travelled from
Switzerland to Berlin on a German diplomatic passport, had
an interview there with Count von Brockdorff-Rantzau, and
four members of the

CXXXI

THE LEAGUE OF NATIONS
(Founded 1920)
The League of Nations came into being on January 10,
1920, when the Treaty of Versailles, incorporating the first
26 articles of " The Covenant of the League " was ratified.
Cradled in Mazzini's Masonic Young Europe movement,
the League and Treaty are the apotheosis of the policy of the
old International Commitree of London and its satellite
societies.
Of these, Mrs Webster, in her <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> The Surrender of an
Empire, 1 gives us the following epitome :
" It was towards 1850 that a modified <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t10 t11 t12 t13 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">form</span> of this scheme
became known as ' The United States of Europe ', The actual
formula seems first to have been <span class="t4 hoverable">used</span> publicly by Victor
Hugo in his opening speech to the <span class="t13 hoverable">Peace</span> Congress held in
Paris in 1849, but it was not until some <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">years</span> later that it was
formally adopted as the slogan of International Socialism.
The impulse came again from the masonic lodges. In 1866,
a Freemason named Santallier composed a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> on Pacifism
for his brother masons which led to the

CXXXII

KENJUKAI

The Tenri Kenjukai, a Japanese politico-religious sect, is
an offshoot of the main cult known as Tenrikyo, itself
dissident from Shintoism, the national religion of Japan.
It is subversive, inasmuch as its adherents <span class="t2 hoverable">object</span> mostly to
one of the main tenets of the Japanese religion, namely, the
traditional regard held for the Imperial Family.
When, in April 1928; the police discovered several plots
for the assassination of members of the Imperial Family and
Conservative Statesmen, it came to <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">light</span> that the Communists
from Moscow had had, as chief tools, Tenri Kenjukaists.
Numerous arrests were made, including that of the founder
of the sect, Aijiro Onishi. His <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">life</span> and behaviour bear a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span>
resemblance to that of the leaders of the O. T. O., of Theodor
Reuss, Rudolf Steiner, Aleister Crowley, Gourgieff, as also of
Piggott of the " Abode of <span class="t0 t2 t5 t7 t8 t13 t15 t17 t18 t21 t22 t23 t26 t27 t28 hoverable">Love</span> " and others.
Like them, Aijiro Onishi exacted a vow of poverty from his
adherents who had to turn over to him all their property. With
this wealth he had built for him641

642

OCCULT

THEOCRASY

self a beautiful <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">house</span> wherein he lived in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> luxury.
Regardless of place, creed or nationality, the same causes
produce the same effects, and greed on the one <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">hand</span> and

THE RACKETS
(Founded 1928)

Racketeering finds a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">place</span> in this study on Occult
Theocrasy because its adepts are the faithful servants of
Mammon and their methods of terrorism, intimidation,
plunder and murder are analogous to those of the Thugs,
worshippers of Siva. Moreover, according to Fred Pasley,
author of Al Capone and Muscling In, racketeering is
organized and controlled by the members of the Italian
Society, the Unione Sicilione, the Mafia, which he calls an
invisible government.
Racketeering, as a system for plundering legitimate
business, often with the connivance of the police and
government officials, has assumed formidable proportions
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t11 t12 t13 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">within</span> the last few years.
Mr. Fred. D. Pasley, in his <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> Muscling In, states that "
The Rackets " started with Prohibition in the United States.
In 1928, after Mussolini had suppressed the terrorist
Sicilian <span class="t1 hoverable">Society</span> known as The Mafia, <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> members <span class="t0 t7 t11 t13 t14 t22 t23 t27 t28 hoverable">took</span>
an oath to " resist <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t18 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Law</span> and defeat Justice ", they found a
refuge in Chicago, U. S. A. There, through their affiliation
with the Unione Sicilione, later known as the Italo-American
Union, they manoeuvred them645

646

OCCULT THEOCRASY

selves into a position which enabled them to cooperate with
the vice and liquor purveyors of the <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">city</span> on the one <span class="t6 hoverable">side</span> and
the political party machines on the other.
To quote Mr. Pasley : 1
" The Unione Sicilione had become a $ 10,000,000 a year
enterprise, supplying the basic ingredient for the synthetic
Bourbon, Rye, Scotch, brandy, rum and gin marketed in and
around Chicago, and controlling the sale of sugar to the
affiliated distillers of the West <span class="t6 hoverable">Side</span> Italian district : Melrose
Park, Cicero, and Chicago Heights. "
The <span class="t7 t11 t15 t22 hoverable">head</span> of the Unione, "... ruled locally as a despot over
some 15,000 Sicilians and dominated the councils of the
Unione's branches in St. Louis, Detroit, Pittsburgh,
Cleveland, Philadelphia and New York City. " He was
virtually the chief executive in the invisible government,
administering the gunman dictatorship of Chicago.
In 1928, the organized gunmen ot Chicago seized control
of the Chicago Coal Teamsters', Chauffeurs' and Helpers'
Union, local No. 704, and the Rackets entered a new phase,
that of economic terrorisation by the armed forces of the
Underworld.
In 1931, the New York Times of November 28 drew the
following picture of the gangster situation :
New York <span class="t0 t2 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">City</span> has become the world's capital of the
racketeers, who " with the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of Tammany hookups,
reinforced with revolver bullets and sawed-off shotgun slugs "
are exacting an annual tribute of at least $ 600,000,000 here,
Fred D. Pasley, biographer of Al Capone, asserts in " Muscling In, " to be published today by Ives Washburn. Every
trade and business organization is racket-ridden, some of the
hardest hit groups being dealers in such foodstuffs as

Asserting that the rise of the racketeer dates from the enactment

Sometimes the rich pay it too. In any case, the honest pay for
the dishonest.

The present wave of International Unemployment is
interesting as an Economic Racket. Already France, England

suddenly <span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span> itself restricted to even county boundaries. In
that event a condition will arise for which there is already an

THE YOUTH <span class="t13 hoverable">PEACE</span> FEDERATION

Early in the 20th Century the headquarters of The Worker,
the Communist weekly, were at 8 East 10th Street, New
York. It also harboured a " Youth Movement " imported
from Germany.
In a pamphlet issued by the Massachusetts Public Interest
League, (210 Newbury Street, Boston, Mass. April 1925) we
read that this " Youth Movement " was sponsored by The
National Student Forum, an organization " made up of those
elements in the colleges which have at different times <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">called</span>
themselves Inter-collegiate Socialist Societies, Liberal
Leagues and Leagues for Industrial Democracy. It was
Lenin's cleverness which suggested ' frequent changes of
name ' to radical organizations. This bewilders the public and
the new names serve as an alias. "
An article in the Survey Graphic for December 1921 stated
the aims of this movement to include advocation of the
Nudity Cult and promiscuity in sex relationships under the
name of <span class="t8 t11 t14 t19 hoverable">free</span> love. Its advocacy of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Body</span> worship enables us to
classify it as " Phallic ".

R. M. Whitney, in a pamphlet entitled The

CXXXVII

THE INTERNATIONAL BANK
(Founded 1930)
The Internationalization of finance reached its apotheosis
when, on April 23 1930 the International Bank at Basle,
commissioned to enrol the central banks of nine nations in its
membership, was founded.
As for the delegates from the different countries attending
the meeting their names signify little for, owing to the speed
and unanimity with which official appointments were made,
it is evident that they were all instructed, or, in other <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">words</span>
pledged, to obey orders. By whom were the orders given ?
History may answer that question some day!
Mr. Gates McGarrah was elected chairman of the board of
directors with Mr. Leon Frazer his deputy and Sir Charles
Addis and Dr. Melchior were elected vice-chairmen.
The significance of this international institution was
commented <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> in an article entitled " Mammon being
enthroned" by " Arthurian" in the Referee dated Sunday,

attainment of their ideals or aims. The study of secret
revolutionary societies will show many examples of
remarkable cases of self <span class="t2 t9 t10 t16 t18 t19 t27 t28 hoverable">sacrifice</span> on the part of genuine

664

OCCULT THEOCRASY

idealists. Subversives of either religious, social and political
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> have ever known how to make <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of such <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">people</span> by
instilling into them the super religion of the secret.
It is against this " secret " that the fight should be waged. If
the aims of secret societies are good, one fails to see the need
for their secret oaths and initiations. The "light " they promise
should, like the sun, shine <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> everyone.
To <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">words</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t3 t4 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Christ</span> : " Who lighteth a candle and
putteth it under a bushel ? "
Masonic and secret societies need light.
Hence, <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Light</span> should be thrown <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> them from <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span>
that their secrets may be revealed.
As to " Toleration " — indiscriminate toleration preached
at random, it should be considered one of the exoteric bases
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> which are erected subversive creeds.
Recognizing as they do the practical <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of thought,
sects induce their novices to surrender their <span class="t4 t18 hoverable">use</span> of this <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span>
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">whose</span> normal function, guided by the individual conscience,
is to discriminate between <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">good</span> and <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">evil</span> in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to oppose
the latter. <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Thus</span> they create a dangerous negative <span class="t1 t2 t5 t8 t10 t16 t19 hoverable">state</span> of <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">mind</span>
as opposed to the Christian or positive. The individual when
robbed of his initiative can easily be swayed and guided by
the will of others. Therein resides the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">power</span> of hypnotism
and in this <span class="t8 t12 t17 hoverable">wise</span> the shibboleth of " toleration " which, in fact,
paralyses opposition to evil, serves an esoteric purpose
suspected by few.
If the contents of this <span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> may help in safeguarding the
young and the unwary against falling into the pitfalls <span class="t0 t2 t3 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">set</span> by
agents of subversive sects, its author will not have laboured
in vain.
The <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> is far from being completed. It claims, in

CONCLUSION

665

fact, to be only an attempt in the direction of inexhaustible
research <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">upon</span> the coordination of the aims of all
societies <span class="t10 t12 t16 t20 t21 t25 t26 t27 hoverable">whether</span> political or occult. It is to be hoped that
others, and may they be many, will begin <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">work</span> where this
<span class="t1 t4 t7 t15 t18 t20 t27 hoverable">book</span> ends for —
" The harvest is <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">great</span> indeed but the labourers are few "

The names of women members are never divulged.

occult bodies again under one governance.
The letters 0. T. 0. represent the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">words</span> Ordo Templi Orientis
(Order of the Temple of the Orient, or Oriental Templars), but they
have also a secret <span class="t1 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t17 t18 t19 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">meaning</span> for initiates.

civilized country of the world.
4. The aims of the 0. T. 0. can only be understood fully by its
<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t8 t10 t12 t16 t19 t20 t21 t22 t25 t29 hoverable">highest</span> initiates ; but it may be said openly that it teaches Hermetic

the Secrets of Mystic attainment, Yoga of all forms, Gnana Yoga,
Raja Yoga, Bhakta Yoga and Hatha Yoga, and all other branches of
the secret <span class="t12 t20 t25 t26 t29 hoverable">Wisdom</span> of the Ancients.
In its bosom repose the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Great</span> Mysteries ; its brain has resolved
all the problems of philosophy and of life.
It possesses the secret of the Stone of the Wise, of the Elixir of
Immortality, and of the Universal Medicine.
Moreover, it possesses a Secret capable of realizing the world-old
dream of the Brotherhood of Man.
It also possesses in every important centre of population a hidden
Retreat (Collegium ad Spiritum Sanctum) where members may
conceal themselves in <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">order</span> to pursue the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Great</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Work</span> <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">without</span>
hindrance.

<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Nature</span> to <span class="t4 t6 t7 t9 t12 t13 t14 t15 t17 t18 t20 t22 t23 t24 t26 t27 hoverable">bring</span> out of a <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">man</span> all that is best in him.

The name of the <span class="t1 t8 t11 t16 t20 t21 t25 t29 hoverable">Person</span> occupying this office is never disclosed
except to his immediate representatives.

10. Application for admission to the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t29 hoverable">Order</span> may be made

<span class="t7 hoverable">Third</span> Degree ; in the latter, it should be enclosed with the
application.

Degree ; if this is <span class="t7 t10 t12 t26 hoverable">taken</span> after June 30 in any year, only half the
amount is due.

13. The privileges of members of the 0. T. 0. are very
numerous. These are the principal;
1° They have not only access to, but instruction in, the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span>

selected for invitation to the higher, where all <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">things</span> are declared

2° They become partakers of the current of Universal <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Life</span> in

<span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">heart</span> of the 0. T. 0, and the <span class="t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t11 t12 t13 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t23 t24 t25 t26 t27 t28 t29 hoverable">Light</span> of that august fraternity
insensibly illuminates them and more as they approach its central
Sun.
3° They meet those persons most complemental to their own
natures, and <span class="t11 t12 t22 t25 t27 hoverable">find</span> unexpected help and brotherhood in the <span class="t0 t1 t2 t3 t4 t5 t6 t7 t8 t9 t10 t12 t14 t15 t16 t17 t18 t19 t20 t21 t22 t24 t25 t26 t28 t29 hoverable">whole</span>

0. T. 0., permanently or for a greater or
